name: Cabo de Gata Natural Park
description: Stunning natural park featuring pristine beaches, volcanic rock formations, dramatic cliffs, and crystal-clear waters. One of the most beautiful and unspoiled coastal areas in Spain with secluded coves and exceptional hiking trails.

name: Parque Natural de Cabo de Gata-Níjar
description: Coastal natural park with wild beaches, coves and desert-like volcanic landscapes.

name: Dolmens of Antequera
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring ancient burial mounds from the Neolithic period. Includes three megalithic monuments: Menga, Viera, and El Romeral dolmens, showcasing prehistoric engineering and astronomical alignment.

name: El Torcal de Antequera
description: Spectacular limestone rock formations shaped by millions of years of wind and rain, creating otherworldly landscape. Features winding paths between towering rock columns and hidden valleys with mountain goats and griffon vultures. Part of UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Gruta de las Maravillas (Cave of Wonders)
description: More than a kilometer tour of enormous limestone caves located under the hill topped by a castle ruin and church. The biggest tourist attraction in Aracena featuring spectacular stalactites and stalagmites formations.

name: Arcos de la Frontera
description: Dramatic white village perched on limestone ridge with sheer cliff drops. Gateway to pueblos blancos route with spectacular views. Features historic castle, Santa María church, and maze of narrow streets with traditional whitewashed houses.

name: Caminito del Rey
description: Spectacular cliffside walkway through Desfiladero de los Gaitanes gorge.

name: Baeza Historic Center
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site with compact almost-medieval center. Features beautiful Renaissance architecture including cathedral, university, Plaza del Pópulo, Moorish city gate, and Plaza de España. Can be explored in half day.

name: Bolonia Dunes
description: Spectacular 30m-high sand dune overlooking pristine beach and Roman ruins. One of largest moving dunes in Europe with stunning Atlantic Ocean views. Adjacent Baelo Claudia Roman archaeological site adds historical dimension.

name: Caminito del Rey
description: Spectacular 7.7km walkway pinned 100m above the Gaitanes Gorge, once known as the world's most dangerous hike. Completely renovated in 2015 with new safe boardwalks. Offers breathtaking views and thrilling experience. Originally built in 1905 for hydroelectric plant workers and inaugurated by King Alfonso XIII in 1921.

name: Frigiliana
description: Voted 'Prettiest Village in Andalusia' by Spanish Tourism Authority. Features white-washed houses with colorful blue accents, winding cobblestone streets, and sweeping Mediterranean views. Charming pedestrian streets with shops, restaurants, and scenic overlooks.

name: Museo de la Capilla Real
description: Museum and Royal Chapel with tombs of the Catholic Monarchs and religious art.

name: Las Alpujarras Villages
description: Cluster of picturesque whitewashed villages nestled in Sierra Nevada foothills including Pampaneira, Bubión, and Capileira. Features unique flat-roofed architecture, narrow streets, and stunning mountain views. Traditional Berber-influenced culture remains.

name: Grazalema Natural Park
description: Spectacular mountain nature reserve with dramatic limestone peaks, deep gorges, and ancient pinsapo (Spanish fir) forests. One of Spain's wettest places creating lush vegetation. Excellent hiking with routes for all levels. Includes charming white village of Grazalema.

name: Guadix Cave District
description: Famous town with unique troglodyte cave houses where locals still live. Features traditional rock-cut dwellings demonstrating centuries-old way of life. Also includes the Alcazaba Moorish fortress with panoramic views offering glimpse into medieval history.

name: Doñana National Park
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site and Biosphere Reserve featuring vast wetlands, marshes, dunes, and forests. One of Europe's most important nature reserves with diverse wildlife including Iberian lynx, flamingos, and imperial eagles. Guided tours required.

name: Jaén Cathedral
description: UNESCO-listed Santa Iglesia Catedral de la Asunción de la Virgen, remarkable Renaissance cathedral that dominates the city skyline. Features intricately sculpted frontal façade and impressive interior. Best viewed from Castillo de Santa Catalina hilltop for commanding perspective.

name: Parque Natural Sierras de Cazorla, Segura y Las Villas
description: Large protected natural area with mountains, forests, reservoirs and wildlife.

name: Jerez Horse Shows
description: World-famous Andalusian horse shows at Real Escuela Andaluza del Arte Ecuestre. Features spectacular displays of Carthusian horses performing classical dressage and traditional equestrian ballet. Between Bulls and Horses tours available.

name: Sherry Bodegas - Jerez
description: World's sherry capital offering tours and tastings at historic bodegas including Tío Pepe (González Byass), Sandeman, and Bodegas Tradición. Learn about traditional sherry production methods and sample various styles.

name: Cahorros de Monachil
description: Popular hiking trail through dramatic gorge with hanging bridges and river crossings. Easily accessible from Granada by public transportation. Features stunning canyon views, cave passages, and refreshing river walks.

name: Nerja Caves
description: Vast caverns containing 25,000-year-old cave paintings and prehistoric artifacts. Home of cavemen thousands of years ago with beautiful stalactites. One of Spain's most impressive cave systems with enormous chambers.

name: La Geoda de Pulpí
description: World's second-largest geode, measuring 8m long and 2m tall, discovered in 2019 in an abandoned silver mine in the Sierra de Aguilón. Features glistening mineral deposits and a cathedral-like cavern with a massive spiral staircase. Requires advance booking for 90-minute Spanish-language guided tours (English guide available upon request).

name: Conjunto Arqueológico de Itálica
description: Extensive Roman archaeological site 10km from Seville featuring well-preserved amphitheater, mosaics, and city ruins. Birthplace of Roman emperors Trajan and Hadrian. One of best-preserved Roman cities in Spain.

name: Setenil de las Bodegas
description: Unique white village with houses built into and under massive rock overhangs. Streets like Calle Cuevas del Sol and Calle Cuevas de la Sombra run beneath huge rock formations. One of most unusual and photogenic pueblos blancos.

name: Las Dueñas Palace
description: House of Alba's current residence in Seville, built between the 15th and 16th centuries. One of the greatest historical attractions of the city featuring stunning architecture and beautiful courtyards with lush gardens.

name: Metropol Parasol
description: Huge modern wooden structure with elevated walkways and sunset views over Seville's old town.
address: Pl. de la Encarnación, s/n, 41003 Sevilla

name: Parque de María Luisa
description: Large historic park surrounding Plaza de España with shaded paths and fountains.
address: Paseo de las Delicias, s/n, 41013 Sevilla

name: Real Alcázar de Sevilla
description: Stunning royal palace with Mudéjar architecture, lush gardens, and Game of Thrones filming location.

name: Seville Cathedral
description: Gothic cathedral and UNESCO site, resting place of Christopher Columbus with the Giralda bell tower.
address: Avenida de la Constitución, s/n, 41004 Sevilla

name: Mulhacén Peak
description: At 3,479m, Mulhacén is the highest peak in mainland Spain and Western Europe outside the Alps. Part of Sierra Nevada National Park and UNESCO Biosphere Reserve. Offers day hikes with spectacular views extending to Africa on clear days.

name: Tabernas Desert
description: Europe's only true desert covering 280km2 with spectacular badlands topography, ravines, and striking rock formations. Known as 'Andalusian Hollywood' for being the backdrop of many Western films. Features old film sets including Mini Hollywood theme park.

name: Tarifa Beaches & Kite Surfing
description: Southernmost point of Continental Europe offering views of Africa across strait. World-renowned kite surfing and windsurfing destination with consistent winds. Beautiful beaches where Atlantic meets Mediterranean. Historic old town with 13th-century walls.

name: Úbeda Renaissance Quarter
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring stunning Renaissance buildings designed by architect Andrés de Vandelvira. Highlights include Capilla del Salvador, Palacio del Deán Ortega, and Church of Santa María de los Reales Alcázares. Flourished in 16th century after Catholic reconquest.

name: Vejer de la Frontera
description: Stunning hilltop white village with maze of narrow streets, whitewashed houses, and Moorish architecture. Offers panoramic views over countryside and coast. One of most beautiful pueblos blancos with rich history and vibrant artistic community.

name: Zahara de la Sierra
description: Picture-perfect white village crowned by Moorish castle ruins overlooking turquoise reservoir. One of most photographed pueblos blancos with stunning mountain backdrop. Features steep cobbled streets and magnificent panoramic views from castle.

name: Almonaster la Real
description: Picturesque white village in Sierra de Aracena featuring one of best-preserved rural mosques in Spain (10th century). Hilltop location offers beautiful views. One of most beautiful villages in Andalusia with authentic atmosphere.

name: La Peña de los Enamorados
description: Dramatic 800-meter-high limestone rock formation resembling a sleeping face. Part of UNESCO World Heritage Site with Antequera Dolmens. Known locally as 'Lovers' Rock' with romantic legend attached.

name: Museo del Jamón - Aracena
description: Museum dedicated to Sierra de Aracena's landscape and traditional pig-rearing methods producing Spain's most revered jamón ibérico. Audio guides available in five languages. Nearby Jabugo produces world's best jamón with farm tours available.

name: Lake Negratin
description: Massive freshwater lake created by Negratin Dam on Guadiana Menor River with ever-changing colors from turquoise to cobalt blue. Features swimming spots like Playa de Freila and nearby thermal hot springs at Baños de Zujar.

name: Castillo de Santa Catalina
description: Picturesque castle ruin atop hill with panoramic views over entire city and olive groves. Now houses a parador hotel. Offers spectacular perspective of Jaén Cathedral's dominance over the cityscape.

name: La Concha Mountain
description: Glorious mountain peak visible from Golden Mile beaches around Marbella. Strenuous 13.5km hike with 680m ascent taking about 5 hours. Views extend along coastline to Gibraltar and across to North African coast. Best route starts from Refugio el Juanar.

name: Trevélez
description: Highest village in mainland Spain at 1,476m in Las Alpujarras. Famous for producing exceptional jamón serrano cured in mountain air. Base for hiking Mulhacén peak with stunning Sierra Nevada views.

name: Sacromonte Abbey
description: 17th-century Benedictine monastery built into the hillside of Sacromonte, known as the site where Granada's patron saint San Cecilio was martyred. Features beautiful baroque architecture and panoramic city views.

name: Granada Science Park
description: Interactive science museum perfect for families, featuring hands-on exhibits about physics, biology, astronomy, and technology. Includes a planetarium, observation tower, and tropical butterfly house.

name: Carmen de los Mártires
description: Romantic 19th-century carmen garden near the Alhambra featuring multiple garden styles including English, French, and Nasrid. Free admission and peaceful atmosphere with ponds, sculptures, and exotic plants.
opening_hours: Spring for flowers, or any morning

name: Barrio Santa Cruz
description: The Barrio Santa Cruz used to be the Jewish quarter. The streets are narrow and form a labyrinth. It's easy to get lost among the jasmine-scented streets… only to discover a convent or a palace or a hotel. Many of the palaces have wrought iron gates suitable for peeping into their beautiful patios. There are many small stores and some artisan shops, as well as good art galleries.
opening_hours: Evening for best atmosphere and dining

name: Torre del Oro
description: Rumor has it that this beautiful tower was once tiled in gold; now, it houses a museum detailing the maritime history of the city.
address: Paseo de Cristóbal Colón, s/n, 41001 Sevilla
opening_hours: Late afternoon for river walk and photos

name: Casa de Pilatos
description: A magnificent Renaissance palace featuring a stunning blend of Mudéjar, Gothic, and Renaissance architecture. The palace includes beautiful courtyards, extensive gardens, and impressive tile work throughout.

name: Triana District
description: Famous historic district across the Guadalquivir River, known for its flamenco heritage, ceramic workshops, and authentic local atmosphere. Traditional neighborhood with vibrant markets, tapas bars, and strong cultural identity.

name: Museum of Flamenco Dance
description: The Flamenco Dance Museum in Seville is the principal reference of the Andalusian cultural heritage, which makes understand and feel the union between culture and flamenco art. It is considered therefore as the temple of the Andalusian flamenco culture, fusing the tradition of flamenco art with high technology.

name: Royal Andalusian School of Equestrian Art
description: World-renowned equestrian center showcasing the training and beauty of Andalusian horses. Features spectacular 'How the Andalusian Horses Dance' shows combining classical dressage, carriage driving, and Spanish music.

name: Alcázar of Jerez
description: 11th-century Moorish fortress featuring beautiful gardens, a working mosque preserved from Islamic times, and Arab baths. The palace complex showcases mudéjar architecture and panoramic city views from the tower.
opening_hours: Morning or late afternoon to avoid midday heat

name: Sherry Triangle Bodegas
description: Historic sherry wine cellars in the city center, including famous names like Tío Pepe (González Byass), Sandeman, and Lustau. Tours explain the solera aging system and include tastings of different sherry styles.
opening_hours: Morning or early afternoon for tours

name: Jerez Cathedral
description: Impressive cathedral combining Gothic, Baroque, and Neoclassical styles, built over several centuries. Houses Zurbarán's painting 'The Sleeping Girl' and offers tower climbs for city views.

name: Flamenco Center (Centro Andaluz de Flamenco)
description: Comprehensive museum and research center dedicated to flamenco art in one of its birthplace cities. Features multimedia exhibits, historic recordings, costume displays, and live performances.

name: Barrio de Santiago
description: Authentic gitano (gypsy) neighborhood considered the cradle of flamenco in Jerez. Whitewashed streets filled with traditional peñas (flamenco clubs) offering intimate performances and authentic atmosphere.

name: Archaeological Museum
description: Comprehensive museum showcasing the region's history from prehistoric times through the Moorish period. Notable for its Greek helmet and medieval collections, housed in a modern building.

name: Villamarta Theatre
description: Beautiful early 20th-century theater with art nouveau influences, serving as Jerez's main performance venue. Features ornate interior decoration and hosts opera, ballet, and flamenco performances.

name: Catedral de Sevilla
description: One of the largest Gothic cathedrals in the world, built on site of former mosque. Houses tomb of Christopher Columbus. Combined ticket includes access to Giralda tower with panoramic city views.
address: Avenida de la Constitución, s/n, 41004 Sevilla

name: Torre Giralda
description: Former minaret of the mosque, now bell tower of Seville Cathedral. Access via Cathedral admission. Climb 35 ramps (not stairs) for fabulous panoramic views of the city.
address: Avenida de la Constitución, s/n, 41004 Sevilla

name: Palacio De Las Duenas
description: Residence of the Duke of Alba, one of main highlights of Seville. Wonderful palace with beautiful courtyards, gardens, and art collection. Renaissance and mudéjar architecture.

name: Iglesia Colegial del Salvador
description: Baroque church included with Cathedral ticket. Built on site of first main mosque of Seville. Beautiful baroque interior with impressive altar and religious art.

name: Calle Sierpes
description: Since medieval times, one of main commerce streets in Seville. Pedestrian shopping street with traditional shops, cafes, and Sevillian atmosphere. Historic commercial heart of city.

name: Plaza del Triunfo
description: Historic plaza and fine starting point to enjoy Seville's great architecture. Surrounded by Cathedral, Alcázar, and Archivo de Indias. Central meeting point for tourists.

name: Torre Sevilla
description: Modern observation tower with viewing deck offering panoramic city views. Glass viewpoints etched with landmarks for easy identification. Can be windy at top.
address: Calle Gonzalo Jiménez de Quesada, 2, 41092 Sevilla

name: Plaza de America
description: Beautiful garden plaza near Plaza de España in María Luisa Park. Home to free Archaeological Museum and Museum of Popular Arts. Pleasant green space with fountains.

name: Iglesia de Santa María la Blanca
description: Recently restored church dating back to 11th century. Originally a mosque, converted into synagogue, then church. Beautiful baroque interior with impressive artwork.
address: Calle Santa María la Blanca, s/n, 41004 Sevilla

name: Convento de Santa Ines
description: High point of walk in Macarena district. Working convent where you can ring bell and purchase traditional sweets made by nuns. Authentic convent experience.

name: Plaza Nueva
description: Plaza behind town hall with amazing animated Christmas lights display. Features statue of King Ferdinand III. Popular gathering spot and event space.

name: Casa de Salinas
description: Beautiful private palace showing how modern people can still live in historic houses. Renaissance and mudéjar architecture with courtyards and gardens. Working noble residence.

name: Plaza Del Cabildo
description: Charming semicircular plaza with white crescent-shaped building, 4 floors high. Features small fountain in center. Stamp and coin market on Sundays.

name: Casa Fabiola
description: Beautiful old palace with tiled walls arranged around central courtyard. Houses fascinating works of art from private collection. Intimate museum experience.

name: Paseo de Las Delicias
description: Broad tree-lined avenue perfect for leisurely walks. Runs along the Guadalquivir River with gardens, monuments, and pleasant atmosphere. Popular for jogging and cycling.

name: Edificio La Adriatica
description: Beautiful early 20th century building (1920s) built for insurance company. Stunning example of regionalist architecture with decorative elements. Landmark building in city center.

name: Iglesia De San Luis De Los Franceses
description: Best example of baroque architecture in Seville. Gorgeous crypt and courtyard garden unlike anything seen before. Recently restored and opened to public. Absolutely stunning interior.

name: Ayuntamiento (City Hall)
description: City Hall building like no other, situated in Plaza Nueva. Features two distinct facades - elaborate plateresque on one side, neoclassical on other. Guided tours available.

name: Capilla de los Marineros
description: First Triana church visited on cycling tours. Set in peaceful street parallel to river. Beautiful baroque chapel dedicated to sailors and maritime community.

name: Plaza de San Francisco
description: Very nice square with Banco de España at one end. Features two trees with foliage cut to form umbrella shape. Popular meeting spot near City Hall.

name: Basilica de Jesús del Gran Poder
description: Jesus del Gran Poder (Jesus of the Great Power) is one of three most venerated icons in Seville. Important basilica for Holy Week processions with impressive baroque interior.

name: Basílica del Santísimo Cristo de la Expiración
description: Basilica devoted to moment of death of Jesus Christ, known in Seville as El Cachorro. Important Holy Week procession church with moving religious imagery.

name: Walls of Seville
description: From 18 original gates, only four survived - Puerta de la Macarena, Puerta de Córdoba, Postigo del Aceite and Postigo del Carbón. Medieval fortification remnants.

name: Glorieta de Becquer
description: Monument in María Luisa Park paying tribute to romantic poet Gustavo Adolfo Bécquer. Beautiful garden setting with sculptures and trees.

name: Torre de los Perdigones
description: Old tower housing interesting camera obscura. Former shot tower used for making lead shot. Offers city views and unique optical experience.

name: Avenida de la Constitucion
description: 600m long pedestrian avenue starting at iconic Puerta de Jerez and ending at Plaza Nueva by Ayuntamiento. Main thoroughfare connecting major monuments.

name: Iglesia de San Pedro
description: Beautiful church with architecture different from typical Catholic churches. Very beautiful interior with artistic elements worth visiting.

name: Iglesia de San Lorenzo
description: Exterior including square tower is very plain but features fine baroque interior. Contains important Jesus del Gran Poder brotherhood chapel.

name: Iglesia de Santa Marina
description: First place of mosque in 10th century, became Christian church in 13th century. Restored mudéjar church with historic significance and beautiful architecture.

name: Iglesia de San Marcos
description: Gothic-mudéjar church with beautiful tower. Part of historic church route in Seville. Located near Macarena district with interesting architecture.

name: Iglesia de San Ildefonso
description: Baroque church with three distinctive towers. Beautiful interior worth visiting, even during services. Historic neighborhood church.

name: Iglesia de San Juan de la Palma
description: Church with high vaulted ceilings and painted domes. Highly decorative gold screen behind altar. Stunning interior worth visiting.
address: Calle San Juan de la Palma, 41003 Sevilla

name: Iglesia de San Nicolas de Bari
description: Gothic-mudéjar church with beautiful tower and historic significance. One of Seville's important neighborhood churches with artistic elements.

name: Parroquia de Omnium Sanctorum
description: Historic church rebuilt in current presence. Free admission though small donation appreciated. Contains notable historic elements and religious art.

name: Parroquia de San Jacinto
description: Dominican church designed by Matias de Figueroa. Beautiful baroque church in Triana district with impressive architecture.

name: Parroquia Del Sagrado Corazon
description: Sacred Heart parish church with beautiful interior and religious artwork. Neighborhood church serving local community.
address: Calle Jesus del Gran Poder, 65, 41002 Sevilla

name: Puente de San Bernardo
description: Beautiful 19th century bridge over former river (now covered/underground). Historic bridge with architectural interest and sunset views.

name: Calle Francos
description: Historic street with many coffee shops, restaurants, and commerce. Shady street perfect for hot days in historic center.

name: The Alhambra
description: Stunning Moorish palace and fortress complex featuring intricate Islamic architecture, beautiful gardens, and breathtaking views of Granada. One of Spain's most visited monuments and a UNESCO World Heritage site.
address: Calle Real de la Alhambra, s/n, 18009 Granada, Spain

name: Royal Chapel of Granada
description: Gothic-style chapel housing the tombs of Catholic Monarchs Ferdinand and Isabella, featuring ornate architecture, religious art, and royal burial chambers.
opening_hours: Mon-Sat 10:15 AM - 6:30 PM, Sun 11:00 AM - 6:00 PM

name: Carrera del Darro
description: Picturesque riverside street along the Darro River offering stunning views of the Alhambra, historic bridges, and charming architecture. Perfect for leisurely walks.

name: Albaicín
description: Historic Moorish quarter with narrow winding streets, white-washed houses, traditional teahouses, and spectacular views of the Alhambra. UNESCO World Heritage site.

name: Monasterio de la Cartuja
description: Stunning Baroque monastery featuring breathtaking ornate ceilings, intricate marble work, and peaceful cloisters. Often called the Christian Alhambra for its lavish decoration.
address: Paseo de Cartuja, s/n, 18011 Granada, Spain

name: Paseo de los Tristes
description: Charming riverside promenade with cafes and restaurants offering magnificent views of the Alhambra. Popular spot for coffee with a view.
address: Paseo de los Tristes, Albaicín, Granada, Spain

name: Granada Cathedral
description: Magnificent Renaissance cathedral with impressive facade, soaring interior, and beautiful chapels. One of Spain's architectural masterpieces built on the site of Granada's main mosque.
address: Calle Gran Vía de Colón, 5, 18001 Granada, Spain
opening_hours: Mon-Sat 10:00 AM - 6:30 PM, Sun 3:00 PM - 6:00 PM

name: La Madraza
description: Historic former Islamic university and prayer room with stunning Moorish decoration, including an ornate prayer hall with intricate tilework and carved plasterwork.

name: Museo Cuevas del Sacromonte
description: Unique cave museum showcasing traditional gypsy cave dwellings with authentic furnishings, tools, and displays about flamenco culture and the history of Sacromonte.
address: Barranco de los Negros, s/n, 18010 Granada, Spain

name: Alcazaba
description: Medieval military fortress within the Alhambra complex offering spectacular panoramic views of Granada from its towers and ramparts.

name: San Miguel Alto Viewpoint
description: Highest viewpoint in the Albaicín offering spectacular panoramic views of Granada, the Alhambra, and Sierra Nevada mountains. Less crowded than San Nicolás.
address: Calle Atarazana Vieja, Albaicín, 18010 Granada, Spain

name: Plaza Bib-Rambla
description: Lively central square with flower stalls, outdoor cafes, and a central fountain. Popular meeting point and gateway to the old city center.

name: Palacio de los Olvidados
description: Museum featuring exhibitions on the Spanish Inquisition and Sephardic Jewish history, housed in a restored historic palace in the Albaicín.
address: Cuesta de Santa Inés, 6, 18010 Granada, Spain

name: Mirador de San Cristóbal
description: Quieter alternative viewpoint offering excellent views of the Alhambra and Granada, less crowded than San Nicolás. Great for photography.
address: Mirador de San Cristóbal, Albaicín, Granada, Spain

name: Archive Saint John of God Museum
description: Museum and archive dedicated to Saint John of God, featuring historical documents, religious art, and guided tours about the saint's life and charitable work.

name: Monasterio de la Concepción
description: Beautiful baroque convent featuring stunning interior decoration, religious art, and peaceful cloisters. Excellent value at €5 entrance fee.
address: Plaza de las Monjas, s/n, 18010 Granada, Spain

name: Huerta de San Vicente - Casa Museo Federico García Lorca
description: Summer home of poet Federico García Lorca, now a museum with guided tours showcasing his life, original furnishings, and beautiful surrounding gardens.
address: Calle Virgen Blanca, s/n, 18004 Granada, Spain

name: Casa Museo Max Moreau
description: Small museum dedicated to Belgian painter Max Moreau who lived in Granada, featuring his artwork and period furnishings in a charming Albaicín location.
address: Camino Nuevo de San Nicolás, 12, 18010 Granada, Spain

name: Casa-Museo de Manuel de Falla
description: Former home of renowned composer Manuel de Falla, featuring his personal belongings, piano, and manuscripts with beautiful views of the Alhambra.

name: Casa de Zafra
description: 14th-century Moorish house featuring traditional architecture and serving as an interpretation center for the Albaicín neighborhood's history.
address: Calle Portería de la Concepción, 8, 18010 Granada, Spain

name: Museo Casa de Los Tiros
description: Historic 16th-century palace museum showcasing Granada's history and culture through arts, crafts, and historical artifacts.
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 9:00 AM - 9:00 PM, Sun 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM

name: Patio de los Perfumes
description: Charming perfume shop and small museum in a beautiful historic building offering traditional Arabian fragrances and perfume-making workshops.

name: La Ermita de San Miguel Alto
description: Historic hermitage chapel at the highest point of Albaicín offering spectacular panoramic views of Granada and the Alhambra, worth the uphill walk.
address: Calle San Miguel Alto, s/n, 18010 Granada, Spain

name: Plaza de Toros de Granada
description: 19th-century neo-Mudéjar bullring offering guided tours showcasing bullfighting history, architecture, and behind-the-scenes areas when not hosting events.

name: Museo de Bellas Artes de Granada
description: Fine arts museum located within the Alhambra grounds in the Palace of Charles V, featuring Spanish art from the 15th to 20th centuries including paintings and sculptures.
address: Palacio de Carlos V, Calle Real de la Alhambra, s/n, 18009 Granada, Spain
entrance_fee: Free for EU citizens, €1.50 for non-EU
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 9:00 AM - 8:00 PM, Sun 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM

name: Museo Sefardí de Granada
description: Sephardic museum documenting the history and culture of Granada's Jewish community before the expulsion of 1492, featuring artifacts and historical exhibits.

name: Museo Caja Granada Memoria de Andalucía
description: Contemporary museum with stunning architecture showcasing detailed information on Andalusian history, culture, and traditions through interactive exhibits.
address: Avenida de la Ciencia, 2, 18006 Granada, Spain

name: Centro Federico García Lorca
description: Cultural center dedicated to poet Federico García Lorca, featuring exhibitions about his life, work, and the cultural atmosphere of his time.
address: Plaza de la Romanilla, 1, 18001 Granada, Spain

name: Palacio de Alcázar Genil
description: Small 13th-century Nasrid palace featuring beautiful Moorish architecture in the same style as the Nasrid Palaces, surrounded by modern apartment blocks.
address: Paseo del Genil, s/n, 18005 Granada, Spain

name: Museo de las Ciencias Padre Suárez
description: Science museum featuring exhibitions on robotics, natural sciences, and technology with interactive displays and temporary exhibitions.
address: Avenida de la Ciencia, s/n, 18006 Granada, Spain

name: Centro José Guerrero
description: Contemporary art center dedicated to abstract painter José Guerrero, featuring rotating exhibitions of modern and contemporary art.

name: Casa de Castril
description: 16th-century Renaissance palace housing the Archaeological Museum of Granada with artifacts from prehistoric to Moorish times.
entrance_fee: Free for EU citizens, €1.50 for non-EU
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 9:00 AM - 8:00 PM, Sun 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM

name: Museo de la Zambra Cueva de Curro
description: Cave museum showcasing traditional gypsy culture and offering authentic flamenco performances in an intimate cave setting in Sacromonte.

name: Museo Etnológico de la Mujer Gitana
description: Small ethnographic museum dedicated to Roma women's history and culture in Granada, featuring traditional clothing, crafts, and historical exhibits.

name: Parroquia de los Santos Justo y Pastor
description: Pleasant baroque church on Plaza de la Universidad featuring an ornate doorway, elaborate interior decoration, and a large dome.
address: Plaza de la Universidad, s/n, 18001 Granada, Spain

name: La Silla del Moro
description: Historic Nasrid lookout point and small fortress ruins on a hilltop offering spectacular views of the Alhambra and surrounding valleys. Beautiful in autumn.

name: Cripta de Fray Leopoldo de Alpandeire
description: Crypt and shrine dedicated to Blessed Friar Leopold, a Capuchin friar known for his charitable work in Granada. Popular pilgrimage site.
address: Iglesia de San Bartolomé y Santiago, Albaicín, Granada, Spain

name: Sala de los Reyes
description: Hall of the Kings within the Nasrid Palaces featuring unique paintings on the central dome depicting Nasrid dynasty kings, chess players, and hunting scenes.
address: Within Nasrid Palaces, Alhambra, Granada, Spain

name: Mirador de la Lona
description: Restaurant viewpoint offering excellent Alhambra views with affordable menu del día (€9) that changes daily. Popular for lunch with a view.

name: Corrala de Santiago
description: Traditional Andalusian corrala (communal courtyard housing) showcasing local living traditions and architecture. Nice place to rest during sightseeing.
address: Calle Aljibe de la Gitana, s/n, 18009 Granada, Spain

name: Carmen del Aljibe del Rey
description: Water interpretation center in historic carmen featuring ancient cistern and exhibitions about Granada's historic water system and Moorish irrigation.
address: Placeta del Aljibe de la Gitana, 4, 18010 Granada, Spain

name: Pilar de Carlos V
description: Renaissance fountain dedicated to Emperor Charles V, located next to the Gate of Justice entrance to the Alhambra, featuring Latin inscription.
address: Plaza de los Aljibes, Alhambra, Granada, Spain

name: Las Cárcavas de Marchal
description: Unique badlands geological formation with dramatic erosion patterns creating a lunar landscape. Two hiking routes available for different perspectives.

name: Convento Santa Cruz la Real
description: Historic convent with beautiful cloister decorated for events, offering views of the Church of Santo Domingo's dome. Peaceful and atmospheric.
address: Cuesta de Santa Inés, s/n, 18009 Granada, Spain

name: Curia y Palacio Arzobispal
description: Archbishop's Palace featuring impressive Plateresque facade, serving as the administrative center for the Archdiocese of Granada.
address: Plaza de las Pasiegas, 2, 18001 Granada, Spain

name: Antiguo Hospital de San Juan de Dios
description: Former hospital founded by Saint John of God, now housing art exhibitions in a venerable and evocative historic building.

name: Casa de Porras
description: Historic Moorish house in the Albaicín featuring traditional architecture and serving as a cultural venue for events and exhibitions.
address: Calle de las Minas, Albaicín, Granada, Spain

name: Campo del Príncipe
description: Beautiful and lively square in Realejo district with numerous bars, restaurants, and cafes. Popular local gathering spot with vibrant atmosphere.

name: Monumento a Isabel la Católica y Cristóbal Colón
description: Monument depicting Queen Isabella I and Christopher Columbus, commemorating their historic meeting. Relocated to current location near Isabella's burial site in 1962.
address: Plaza Isabel la Católica, Granada, Spain

name: Real Chancillería
description: Historic high court building from 16th century with impressive Renaissance architecture. Though Seville is Andalusia's capital, Granada hosts the region's high court.

name: Plaza Larga
description: Authentic local square in the Albaicín with morning market, narrow streets branching off including the pretty Calle del Agua. Central hub of neighborhood life.

name: Monastery of Santa Isabel la Real
description: Convent ordered by Queen Isabella I in 1504, just 12 years after the Reconquista. Features beautiful Gothic and Mudéjar architecture.
address: Calle Santa Isabel la Real, 15, 18010 Granada, Spain

name: Cuarto Real de Santo Domingo
description: 13th-century Nasrid palace tower with glass floor revealing archaeological excavations and simple but pleasant gardens. Good place to pause during touring.
address: Calle Ancha de Capuchinos, 1, 18071 Granada, Spain

name: Murallas del Albayzín
description: Historic Moorish defensive walls of the Albaicín neighborhood, easily explored from Mirador San Nicolás and Plaza Larga. Part of UNESCO site.

name: Convento de Santa Catalina de Zafra
description: Cloistered convent where nuns secretly sell homemade cookies through a revolving window. Traditional Spanish convent experience for savvy visitors.
opening_hours: Cookie sales: limited hours, ring bell

name: Universidad de Granada
description: Historic university with about 500 years of history, ranked among Spain's top ten universities. Beautiful architectural buildings throughout the city.
address: Plaza de la Universidad, s/n, 18001 Granada, Spain

name: Sala de las Dos Hermanas
description: Hall of the Two Sisters in Nasrid Palaces featuring spectacular stalactite dome ceiling and fountain with water channel flowing to Patio de los Leones.
address: Within Nasrid Palaces, Alhambra, Granada, Spain

name: Puerto del Suspiro del Moro
description: Moorish Sigh mountain pass where the last Nasrid king Boabdil reportedly sighed looking back at Granada before exile. Historic and emotional site.

name: Estatua de Yehuda Ibn Tibon
description: Statue commemorating medieval Jewish scholar and translator Yehuda Ibn Tibon, important figure in Granada's Sephardic history.

name: Monumento al Aguador
description: Monument in Plaza de la Romanilla commemorating traditional water carriers (aguadores), revealed in 1999. Depicts water carrier collecting water.
address: Plaza de la Romanilla, Granada, Spain

name: Edificio de la Lonja de Granada
description: Historic merchant exchange building with impressive architectural facade near the Cathedral, representing Granada's commercial history.
address: Plaza de las Pasiegas, Granada, Spain

name: Monumento a Agustín Lara
description: Monument honoring Mexican composer Agustín Lara in Plaza del Ángel, featuring details including a female figure, bull's head, and keyboard.

name: Plaza de Mariana Pineda
description: Square named after liberal heroine Mariana Pineda, executed for her political beliefs. Pleasant plaza with monument and surrounding cafes.
address: Plaza de Mariana Pineda, Granada, Spain

name: Real Monasterio de San Jerónimo
description: Renaissance monastery with impressive church featuring ornate baroque altarpiece and peaceful cloisters. Important religious and architectural monument.
address: Calle Rector López Argüeta, 9, 18071 Granada, Spain

name: Plaza del Realejo
description: Small plaza in the historic Realejo neighborhood, former Jewish quarter with plaques commemorating the area's Sephardic heritage.

name: Ojos del Barroco
description: Contemporary art gallery featuring baroque-inspired works and rotating exhibitions by local and international artists.

name: Contrabanda Granada
description: Specialty shop and art gallery offering unique handcrafted items, local art, and souvenirs in the city center.

name: Galería Fotográfica: Estudio Ruiz Linares
description: Historic photography studio and gallery featuring vintage photographs of Granada and artistic photography exhibitions.

name: Casa Ajsaris
description: Small art museum in a traditional Albaicín house showcasing contemporary and traditional art in an intimate setting.

name: Galería de Arte Granadacapital
description: Art gallery representing quality artists beyond typical tourist-oriented artwork, featuring paintings and contemporary works. Worth stopping in for art lovers.

name: Tienda Souvenirs La Alborea
description: Quality souvenir shop selling olive oil, wines, local produce, plates, drawings, scarves, and other authentic Granada products. Friendly service.

name: Reez
description: Artisan shop featuring beautiful handmade glass jewelry, bowls, and framed photographs produced by Reez and his wife. Unique artistic pieces.

name: Gallery Secret Berbère
description: Small art gallery featuring Berber-inspired art and crafts, offering unique North African artistic perspectives and handcrafted items.

name: La Raíz Espacio de Arte
description: Contemporary art space featuring rotating exhibitions, installations, and cultural events by emerging and established artists.

name: Anticuario Ruíz Linares
description: Antique shop featuring interesting pictures, engravings, ceramics, and furniture. A must for antique collectors and history enthusiasts.

name: Centro Patrimonio Cultural Alpujarra
description: Cultural heritage center dedicated to the history, traditions, and culture of the Alpujarra region, featuring exhibitions and educational programs.

name: Taller de Arte Vimaambi
description: Intimate flamenco venue offering powerful, visceral, and inspiring performances with a modern twist. Excellent value at €15 per ticket.

name: Partal Gardens
description: Beautiful gardens in the Alhambra complex featuring the Partal Palace, reflecting pool, portico, and lush landscaping. Peaceful area with excellent photo opportunities.

name: Abadía del Sacromonte
description: 17th-century baroque abbey perched on a hilltop featuring sacred caves, museum, church, and spectacular views over Granada and the Alhambra.
address: Camino del Sacromonte, s/n, 18010 Granada, Spain

name: Puerta de Elvira
description: 11th-century Moorish gateway, one of the original entrances to the old city. Historic horseshoe arch marking the boundary of medieval Granada.

name: Museo De Bellas Artes De Sevilla
description: One of Spain's finest art museums featuring Andalusian artists and religious-themed paintings. Housed in a beautiful former convent with notable highlights including works from the Golden Age.
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 9:00 AM - 9:00 PM, Sun 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM

name: Museum Of Illusions Sevilla
description: Interactive museum featuring intelligent optical illusions, visual tricks, and fun photo opportunities. Great for families with engaging attractions and memorable experiences.

name: Museo Palacio de la Condesa de Lebrija
description: Stunning palace museum showcasing the collection of the intelligent and courageous Countess of Lebrija, featuring Roman mosaics, archaeological artifacts, and period furnishings.
opening_hours: Mon-Fri 10:30 AM - 7:30 PM, Sat 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Sun 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM

name: Hospital de los Venerables
description: Impressive 17th-century baroque building with stunning decoration, paintings, and architecture. Former hospital now housing cultural center with art collections.
address: Plaza de los Venerables, 8, 41004 Sevilla, Spain

name: Ceramicas Sevilla 1952
description: Excellent ceramic art gallery with warm, enthusiastic, and knowledgeable staff sharing the long and deep history of ceramics in Seville. Quality traditional and contemporary pieces.

name: Archivo General de Indias
description: UNESCO World Heritage site housing extensive archives documenting Spanish colonization of the Americas. Best visited when special exhibitions are in progress.
address: Av. de la Constitución, 3, 41004 Sevilla, Spain
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 9:30 AM - 5:00 PM, Sun 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM

name: Centro Ceramica Triana
description: Great museum explaining ceramic-making processes in the historic Triana district. Includes visits to the original factory premises and displays of traditional techniques.
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 11:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Sun 10:00 AM - 3:00 PM

name: Museum of Popular Arts And Traditions
description: Ethnographic museum featuring Andalusian folk arts, traditions, and crafts in beautiful grounds near Plaza de España. Housed in a lovely historic building.
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 9:00 AM - 9:00 PM, Sun 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM

name: La Casa de la Ciencia de Sevilla
description: Science museum with planetarium (Spanish only) and rotating exhibitions including topics like Egyptian history. Interactive educational displays for families.
address: Av. de María Luisa, 8, 41013 Sevilla, Spain

name: Archaeological Museum of Sevilla
description: Excellent archaeological museum featuring Roman statues and artifacts from Italica, including fantastic monumental sculptures and historical exhibits.
address: Plaza de América, s/n, 41013 Sevilla, Spain
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 9:00 AM - 9:00 PM, Sun 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM

name: La Gata En Bicicleta
description: Artsy cafe gallery with great WiFi, excellent coffee, and cafe menu. Chill spot with creative vibe, popular with locals and regulars.

name: Museo del Baile Flamenco
description: Flamenco dance museum featuring exhibitions about flamenco history, culture, music, and dance. Includes live performances showcasing authentic flamenco artistry.
address: Calle Manuel Rojas Marcos, 3, 41004 Sevilla, Spain

name: Museo Militar Regional
description: Fascinating free military museum covering various aspects of Spanish military history with excellent collections and exhibits. Hidden gem worth discovering.
address: Plaza de España, s/n, 41013 Sevilla, Spain

name: Antigüedades el Museo
description: Antique gallery with enthusiastic service. Also serves as a cafe with seafood platters and wine. Friendly atmosphere with smiling staff.

name: Casa de la Guitarra
description: Intimate flamenco venue featuring exceptional guitarist performances accompanying singers and dancers. Authentic and highly-rated flamenco experience.
address: Calle Mesón del Moro, 12, 41004 Sevilla, Spain

name: Painter Amalio Museum
description: Amazing small museum dedicated to painter Amalio. Top floor window offers views of La Giralda. Hidden gem discovered by chance by many visitors.

name: Musee Flamenco De Seville
description: Flamenco museum featuring beautiful and amazing performances. Essential Seville experience showcasing authentic flamenco culture and artistry.

name: La Galeria Roja
description: Excellent art gallery discovered by chance in great location on small street off main areas. Pleasant surprise with quality contemporary art.

name: El Pianillo Antigüedades
description: Antique shop and art gallery featuring vintage items, collectibles, and artistic pieces. Specialty gift shop with unique finds.

name: Palacio de los marqueses de la Algaba
description: Free museum in lovely historic palace building featuring good displays of Mudéjar architecture and decorative arts. Quick but worthwhile visit.
address: Plaza de la Calzada, s/n, 41003 Sevilla, Spain

name: Sala de Exposiciones Fundacion Cajasol
description: Cultural foundation exhibition space hosting rotating art exhibitions and cultural events in central Seville location.

name: Museo de Musica Africana ¿Te Suena Africa?
description: Unique museum dedicated to African music, featuring instruments, cultural exhibits, and the sounds of Africa. Highly-rated specialized collection.

name: Sorolla Art Gallery
description: Gallery showcasing Sorolla's art displayed on the walls of his own house. Unique museum experience different from typical galleries.

name: Galería Balcris
description: Contemporary art gallery featuring quality exhibitions and local artistic talent in central Seville location.

name: Delimbo
description: Art gallery featuring original works by talented Spanish artists. Serious gallery with pieces priced from €1000 minimum, representing quality contemporary art.

name: La Sala Histórica De Tablada
description: Historical museum dedicated to Tablada's aviation and military history. Specialized collection for history enthusiasts.

name: Triana Es Arte
description: Local art gallery in Triana featuring handmade bracelets, paintings, key chains, and artistic crafts. Nice selection of authentic local artwork.

name: River Park
description: Riverside area with views of cruise boats and canoeing. Good for walking or cycling along the river at a relaxed pace. Family-friendly outdoor space.

name: Centro Andaluz de la Fauna Salvaje
description: Andalusian wildlife center featuring local fauna. Off the beaten track location requiring transportation planning to return to city center.

name: Di Gallery
description: Contemporary art gallery featuring quality exhibitions and artistic works in central Seville.

name: Espacio Primera Vuelta Al Mundo
description: Museum dedicated to the first circumnavigation of the world. Historical exhibition space celebrating Magellan-Elcano expedition.

name: Gallo Rojo Factoria de Creacion
description: Very good place to chill and meet local people around artisanal craft beer. Art gallery combined with bar atmosphere. Must visit for creative vibe.

name: Galería de Arte Alexandra del Bene
description: Sculpture gallery with very nice pieces. Appointment necessary to visit (easily arranged via WhatsApp). Quality artistic sculptures in intimate setting.

name: Más Cara Que Espalda
description: Contemporary art gallery featuring modern artistic works and exhibitions. Small gallery space with quality pieces.

name: Corral del Arte
description: Modern, stylish, one-of-a-kind artisan leather goods. Not rustic but contemporary designs at reasonable prices. Quality craftsmanship comparable to Loewe or Coach.

name: Biblioteca - Museo Mariano Carmen Coronada
description: Religious library and museum dedicated to Marian devotion. Specialized collection featuring religious art and historical artifacts.

name: Galeria Zunino
description: Contemporary art gallery featuring quality exhibitions and artistic works.

name: Ceramica Artistica Colon
description: Artisan ceramic shop featuring traditional Sevillian pottery and tiles. Specialty gift shop with authentic handcrafted pieces.

name: MOSCOW ArtSpirits
description: Contemporary art gallery featuring international artistic perspectives and exhibitions.

name: La Galeller
description: Specialty shop and art gallery combination featuring unique gifts and artistic items.

name: Plüg Art & Co.
description: Contemporary art gallery featuring modern artistic works and creative exhibitions.

name: Mezquita Cathedral de Cordoba
description: Stunning mosque-cathedral featuring iconic red and white arches, intricate Islamic architecture, and Christian additions. UNESCO World Heritage site and one of Spain's most impressive monuments.

name: Alcazar de los Reyes Cristianos
description: Royal palace and fortress with beautiful gardens, water features, and spectacular sound and light shows. Mix of indoor palace rooms and extensive outdoor gardens.
address: Plaza Campo Santo de los Mártires, s/n, 14004 Córdoba, Spain
opening_hours: Tue-Fri 8:15 AM - 8:00 PM, Sat 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM, Sun 8:30 AM - 2:30 PM

name: Centro Histórico de Córdoba
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site featuring the Mezquita, narrow medieval streets, charming patios, and historic landmarks. Perfect for walking and exploring Córdoba's rich history.

name: Patios de Cordoba
description: Traditional Córdoban patios decorated with flowers, plants, and tiles. UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage. Best visited in May during the Patio Festival.
address: Various locations in historic center, Córdoba, Spain

name: Calleja de las Flores
description: Amazing narrow alley full of flowers leading to the Mezquita. Very typical and picturesque street, perfect for photos with flower-decorated walls.
address: Calleja de las Flores, 14003 Córdoba, Spain

name: Patio de los Naranjos
description: Courtyard in front of the Mezquita featuring numerous bitter orange trees. Historic Islamic courtyard serving as the entrance area to the mosque-cathedral.

name: Los Patios de San Basilio
description: Breathtaking traditional patios in San Basilio neighborhood. Perfect to visit in May during patio festival, but enjoyable year-round with beautiful flowers and decorations.
address: Barrio de San Basilio, Córdoba, Spain

name: Capilla Mudéjar de San Bartolomé
description: Beautiful Mudéjar chapel with courtyard exhibition about the architecture. Must-see example of Mudéjar style combining Islamic and Christian elements.
opening_hours: Tue-Fri 9:30 AM - 1:30 PM, 5:30 PM - 7:30 PM, Sat 9:30 AM - 1:30 PM

name: Plaza de Las Tendillas
description: Large-scale open square designed in the 1920s, surrounded by cafes and shops. Only 8-10 minutes from the Mezquita, serving as modern commercial center.
address: Plaza de las Tendillas, 14002 Córdoba, Spain

name: Puerta del Almodovar
description: 14th-century gateway with statue of philosopher Seneca standing sentry-like at the gate. Solid, imposing entrance to the old Jewish quarter.

name: Puerta del Puente
description: Gateway with easy stairs to the top offering great views of the Roman Bridge, monument to San Rafael, and Calahorra Tower.
address: Avenida del Alcázar, s/n, 14003 Córdoba, Spain

name: Palacio de Viana
description: Historic palace featuring 12 beautiful patios and luxurious interior rooms. Free patio visit or full palace tour available. Excellent example of aristocratic Córdoban architecture.
address: Plaza de Don Gome, 2, 14001 Córdoba, Spain
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM, Sun 10:00 AM - 3:00 PM

name: Medina Azahara
description: Spectacular ruins of 10th-century palatine city built by Caliph Abd-ar-Rahman III. UNESCO World Heritage site with museum and archaeological remains. Guided tours recommended.
address: Carretera Palma del Río, km 5.5, 14005 Córdoba, Spain
entrance_fee: Free for EU citizens, €1.50 for non-EU
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Sun 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM

name: Torre de la Calahorra - Museo Vivo de al-Andalus
description: Moorish defensive tower at the far end of Roman Bridge housing museum about al-Andalus history and culture. Audio guide tours available in Spanish and English.

name: Museo Arqueológico de Córdoba
description: Pleasant, well-done archaeological museum that's clean, modern, and easy to navigate. Smaller size makes it manageable with excellent Roman and Moorish collections.
address: Plaza de Jerónimo Páez, 7, 14003 Córdoba, Spain
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 9:00 AM - 9:00 PM, Sun 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM

name: Museo Julio Romero De Torres
description: Art museum dedicated to Córdoban painter Julio Romero de Torres, showcasing detailed portrayals of Andalusian characters from late 19th and early 20th centuries.
opening_hours: Tue-Fri 8:30 AM - 9:00 PM, Sat 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM, Sun 8:30 AM - 2:30 PM

name: Baños Árabes De Santa María
description: Very well-preserved ruins of Arab baths in the historic center. Minimal entry fee for fairly large and impressive archaeological site.
address: Calle Velázquez Bosco, s/n, 14003 Córdoba, Spain
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 8:30 AM - 9:00 PM, Sun 8:30 AM - 2:30 PM

name: Casa-Museo del Guadamecí Omeya
description: Wonderful showcase of Ramón García Romero's life's work featuring sumptuous embossed and gilded leather (guadamecí). Hidden gem discovered by chance.

name: Centro Flamenco Fosforito
description: Charming courtyard museum with various rooms playing different types of flamenco. Perfect for flamenco enthusiasts wanting to learn about the art form.
opening_hours: Mon-Fri 8:30 AM - 9:00 PM, Sat 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM, Sun 8:30 AM - 2:30 PM

name: Synagogue of Córdoba
description: One of only three medieval synagogues preserved in Spain. Small but historically significant building with beautiful Mudéjar decoration from 1315.
entrance_fee: Free for EU citizens, €0.30 for non-EU
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 9:00 AM - 9:00 PM, Sun 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM

name: Roman Bridge (Puente Romano)
description: Ancient Roman bridge spanning the Guadalquivir River with 16 arches. Offers spectacular views of the city and Mezquita, especially at sunset.

name: Jewish Quarter (Judería)
description: Historic Jewish quarter featuring narrow medieval streets, whitewashed houses, synagogue, and charming patios. Heart of Córdoba's UNESCO World Heritage area.

name: Caballerizas Reales
description: Royal stables featuring Spanish horse shows combining equestrianism, flamenco, and music. Beautiful historic building with impressive equestrian performances.
address: Caballerizas Reales, Calle Caballerizas Reales, 1, 14004 Córdoba, Spain

name: Palacio de la Merced
description: Historic palace now serving as provincial government headquarters. Beautiful architecture with lovely Jardines de la Merced gardens across the road.

name: Alcazaba
description: Important military fortification from the Hispanic-Arabic period, built between 1057 and 1063. Features impressive Moorish architecture with beautiful gardens and spectacular city views.

name: Malaga Cathedral
description: Renaissance cathedral known as 'La Manquita' (the one-armed lady) due to its unfinished second tower. More impressive from outside with beautifully carved choir stalls inside.
opening_hours: Mon-Fri 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Sat 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM

name: Castillo de Gibralfaro
description: Moorish castle on hilltop with breathtaking panoramic views of Málaga city and coastline. Walking on the old castle walls is both scary and exhilarating.

name: Museo Picasso Malaga
description: Interesting look into the life and family of Picasso. Book tickets online to avoid queues. Bring headphones for downloadable audio guide for enhanced experience.
address: Palacio de Buenavista, Calle San Agustín, 8, 29015 Málaga, Spain
opening_hours: Daily 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM (Mar-Jun & Sep-Oct), 10:00 AM - 8:00 PM (Jul-Aug)

name: Museo del Automóvil y la Moda de Málaga
description: Fabulous museum cleverly marrying rare cars and fashion in the emblematic La Tabacalera building. Pet-friendly unique cultural space with global appeal.
address: Avenida Sor Teresa Prat, 15, 29003 Málaga, Spain

name: Museo del Vidrio y Cristal de Malaga
description: Museum in carefully restored 18th-century house featuring history of glass and crystal. Excellent guide with deep knowledge, furniture in style chambers creating perfect mix.
address: Plazuela Santísimo Cristo de la Sangre, 2, 29012 Málaga, Spain

name: Oxo - Museo Del Videojuego Málaga
description: So much fun and genuinely educational. Play SO MANY games for extended time. Really thorough history of video games museum perfect for weekends in Málaga.

name: Museo Carmen Thyssen Malaga
description: Very impressive museum with up to 4 floors of paintings, all well worthwhile. Excellent collection of 19th-century Spanish art.

name: Centre Pompidou Málaga
description: Really interesting museum with pleasant, polite receptionists. Features modern and contemporary art exhibitions in colorful cube building on the waterfront.
address: Pasaje Doctor Carrillo Casaux, s/n, 29016 Málaga, Spain

name: Museum Jorge Rando
description: Recommended for anyone with passing interest in Expressionist art. Jorge Rando's paintings are powerful and thought-provoking in dedicated museum space.
address: Calle Cruz del Molinillo, 12, 29013 Málaga, Spain

name: Museo Interactivo de la Musica Malaga
description: Very enjoyable, especially for music lovers. Fun to see variety of instruments even if not particularly musical. Interactive displays and live demonstrations.
opening_hours: Mon-Fri 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM, Sat-Sun 10:00 AM - 8:00 PM

name: Museo de Artes y Costumbres Populares
description: Not the biggest or most famous museum but really worth seeing. Very good value and interesting displays of local traditions and customs.
address: Pasillo de Santa Isabel, 10, 29005 Málaga, Spain

name: Coleccion del Museo Ruso
description: Russian Museum collection featuring War & Peace and other exhibitions. Quality rotating displays from St. Petersburg's Russian Museum collection.
address: Avenida Sor Teresa Prat, 15, 29003 Málaga, Spain

name: Museo Aeronáutico de Málaga
description: Aviation museum displaying historic terminal from 1948, aircraft, power units, and flight tracking equipment. Excellent for aviation and petrol head enthusiasts.
address: Avenida Comandante García Morato, s/n, 29004 Málaga, Spain

name: Revello de Toro Museum
description: Emphasis on female form - portraits, nudes, de Toro's take on the 3 Graces, family pictures. Dedicated to local artist Félix Revello de Toro.
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 10:00 AM - 8:00 PM, Sun 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM

name: Episcopal Palace
description: Very beautiful palace on the square in front of Málaga Cathedral. Impressive baroque facade, not typically open for interior visits but stunning from outside.
address: Plaza del Obispo, s/n, 29015 Málaga, Spain

name: Museo de Arte Flamenco de la Pena Juan Breva Malaga
description: Astonishing flamenco show at pretty high level. Well-built entertainment with authentic performances in intimate setting dedicated to flamenco art.

name: Ifergan Collection
description: Small museum with excellent collection of ancient artifacts from Mesopotamia, Egypt, Greece, Rome, Persia. Beautifully displayed and explained including Salutatis sculptures recovered after 2500 years underwater.

name: MUPAM Museo del Patrimonio Municipal
description: Municipal heritage museum featuring history of Málaga - paintings, models, maps, photos. First floor covers 19th-century history with permanent exhibitions.

name: Centro de Ciencia Principia
description: Science center with interactive exhibits and small but decent planetarium. Even if Spanish language only, exhibits are kinda fun and understandable.
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM, Sun 10:00 AM - 3:00 PM

name: Puerto de Malaga
description: Málaga port area with parks, plazas, bars, restaurants, shopping centers near Cathedral and churches. Vibrant waterfront area perfect for strolling.
address: Muelle Uno, Puerto de Málaga, 29001 Málaga, Spain

name: La Calle Larios
description: Main shopping street in Málaga with lots of shops, restaurants, and hotels including Airbnb locations. Pedestrian street perfect for walking and shopping.
address: Calle Marqués de Larios, 29015 Málaga, Spain

name: Jardin Botanico Historico La Concepcion
description: English landscape garden with over 150 years of history. Located at northern entrance of Málaga, one of the most important tropical botanical gardens in Europe.
address: Camino del Jardín Botánico, 3, 29014 Málaga, Spain

name: Playa de La Malagueta
description: Nice urban beach close to city center with facilities and promenade. Popular local beach with good access and amenities.
address: Paseo Marítimo Pablo Ruiz Picasso, 29016 Málaga, Spain

name: Mercado Central de Atarazanas
description: Great central market housed in beautiful historic building with Moorish gate. Fresh produce, seafood, and local specialties in atmospheric setting.

name: Teatro Romano
description: Well-preserved 1st-century Roman theatre at the foot of the Alcazaba. Free to visit with interpretive center. Important archaeological site in city center.
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Sun 10:00 AM - 4:00 PM

name: Mirador del Gibralfaro
description: Spectacular panoramic viewpoint offering breathtaking views of Málaga city, port, bullring, and Mediterranean Sea from Gibralfaro Castle area.

name: Plaza de la Constitucion
description: Historic central square surrounded by cafes and shops. Heart of Málaga's social life with beautiful architecture and lively atmosphere.
address: Plaza de la Constitución, 29008 Málaga, Spain

name: Palmeral de las Sorpresas
description: Modern waterfront promenade with palm trees, sculptures, cafes, and sea views. Part of renovated port area perfect for leisurely walks.
address: Muelle Dos, Puerto de Málaga, 29001 Málaga, Spain

name: Plaza de la Merced
description: Historic square with Picasso statue and birthplace nearby. Popular plaza surrounded by bars and restaurants with lively local atmosphere.
address: Plaza de la Merced, 29012 Málaga, Spain

name: Muelle Uno
description: Modern shopping and dining complex in renovated port area. Mix of boutiques, restaurants, and entertainment with waterfront views.
address: Muelle Uno, Puerto de Málaga, 29001 Málaga, Spain

name: Plaza del Obispo
description: Beautiful square in front of the Cathedral with Episcopal Palace. Charming plaza with cafes and historic buildings creating picturesque setting.

name: La Farola
description: Historic lighthouse at entrance to Málaga port. Iconic symbol of the city though not open for interior visits. Nice for photos from waterfront.
address: Paseo de la Farola, s/n, 29016 Málaga, Spain

name: Torre Tavira
description: Camera obscura tower offering great views of the city. Highest point in Cádiz with 360-degree panoramic views and fascinating camera obscura demonstration.
address: Calle Marqués del Real Tesoro, 10, 11001 Cádiz, Spain

name: Catedral de Cadiz
description: Stunning cathedral laden with religious and social history. Golden dome visible across the city, baroque and neoclassical architecture. Enhanced experience with audio guide.
address: Plaza de la Catedral, s/n, 11005 Cádiz, Spain
opening_hours: Mon-Sat 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM, Sun 1:30 PM - 7:00 PM

name: Playa Victoria
description: Excellent urban beach with good restaurants on and near beachfront. Local bus number 1 or 7 brings you close for about €1.10. Long sandy beach popular with locals.
address: Playa de la Victoria, Cádiz, Spain

name: Yacimiento Arqueológico Gadir
description: Very small but very well done archaeological site, and you can never be disappointed by something free! Ancient Phoenician settlement ruins at the beginning of Cádiz history.

name: La Vina
description: Vibrant area full of restaurants and amusements. Full of people in summer, true heart of nightlife in the city! Traditional fishermen's quarter with authentic atmosphere.
address: Barrio de La Viña, Cádiz, Spain

name: Oratorio de La Santa Cueva
description: Surprising place with underground chapel and another on first floor where you can admire three Goya paintings. Beautiful baroque oratory with two distinct levels.
opening_hours: Tue-Fri 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM, 4:30 PM - 8:00 PM, Sat-Sun 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM

name: Paseo Canalejas
description: Welcome break from fascinating narrow streets of old town. Promenade with sea on one side and beautiful gardens creating peaceful atmosphere.

name: Plaza De San Juan De Dios
description: Best square in the city. Nothing wow but if you are in Cádiz go there and see it live. Beautiful city hall building and pleasant cafes surround the plaza.
address: Plaza de San Juan de Dios, 11005 Cádiz, Spain

name: Alameda Apodaca
description: Located on harbour side where open Atlantic ocean is literally just around corner. Great spot with gardens and sea views, perfect for relaxing walks.

name: El Populo
description: Lovely old town of Cádiz. Easy to walk around with loads of little narrow streets. Plenty to see and do in medieval quarter, oldest part of city.

name: Castillo de Santa Catalina
description: Well-preserved castle with church and many other buildings inside. Brilliant place to see sunset with ocean views. Star-shaped fortress at La Caleta beach.
address: Paseo Fernando Quiñones, s/n, 11002 Cádiz, Spain

name: Teatro Romano
description: Very interesting information points dotted round inside and nice walk round the Teatro Romano itself. Ancient Roman theatre discovered in 1980, well-preserved ruins.
address: Campo del Sur, s/n, 11004 Cádiz, Spain

name: Plaza de Las Flores
description: Absolute little gem in middle of Cádiz, worth making effort to get here. Flower sellers' stalls create charming atmosphere in this popular square.
address: Plaza de las Flores, 11005 Cádiz, Spain

name: Iglesia del Oratorio de San Felipe Neri
description: High Baroque decoration is stunning, with bonus of having Murillo's last painting. Important historic site where Spain's 1812 Constitution was signed.
opening_hours: Tue-Fri 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM, Sat 10:00 AM - 1:00 PM

name: Monumento A Las Cortes De Cádiz
description: Detail on every aspect of monument to the constitution is incredible. It's huge! Commemorates 1812 Constitution with impressive sculptural work.

name: Puerta de Tierra
description: Monumental access to the city. Also clever idea for parking if free. Feels like being in Portugal here. 18th-century gate marking entrance to old city.
address: Plaza de la Constitución, 11003 Cádiz, Spain

name: Museum of Cadiz
description: Fun place to spend afternoon. History of city is fascinating, beginning with Phoenician origins. Archaeological collections and fine arts sections.
address: Plaza de Mina, s/n, 11004 Cádiz, Spain
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 9:00 AM - 9:00 PM, Sun 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM

name: La Caleta Beach
description: Historic small beach between two castles in old city. Charming cove with calm waters, popular for sunset views. Featured in James Bond films.
address: Playa de La Caleta, 11002 Cádiz, Spain

name: Parque Genovés
description: Beautiful landscaped garden with exotic plants, waterfalls, and grotto. Peaceful oasis in the city with shaded paths and ocean views.
address: Avenida Dr. Gómez Ulla, 11003 Cádiz, Spain

name: Castillo de San Sebastián
description: Castle on island connected by causeway offering spectacular ocean views. Historic fortress with lighthouse, popular for walks and photography.
address: Paseo Fernando Quiñones, s/n, 11002 Cádiz, Spain

name: Gran Teatro Falla
description: Beautiful neo-Mudéjar theatre, venue for famous Carnival competitions. Stunning red-brick facade and ornate interior hosting concerts and performances.
address: Plaza de Falla, s/n, 11003 Cádiz, Spain
opening_hours: Box office: Mon-Fri 11:00 AM - 2:00 PM, 5:00 PM - 8:00 PM

name: MUSEO DEL TÍTERE
description: Museum of puppets - if you love puppets you'll love this museum. Unfortunately all in Spanish, but quality and beauty of puppets speaks for itself.
address: Calle San Antonio Abad, 61, 11003 Cádiz, Spain
opening_hours: Mon-Fri 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM, Sat-Sun 11:00 AM - 2:00 PM

name: Central Market (Mercado Central)
description: Central food market with fresh seafood, produce, and local specialties. Historic building housing vibrant daily market popular with locals.
address: Plaza de la Libertad, s/n, 11006 Cádiz, Spain

name: New Bridge (Puente Nuevo)
description: Top attraction in Ronda, rightfully so. Make time and effort to walk down to the back for spectacular gorge views. Marvel of engineering spanning El Tajo gorge. Best photo opportunity from both sides.

name: El Tajo de Ronda
description: Spectacular gorge with New Bridge as marvel to see. Good place to descend into gorge from Plaza de María Auxiliadora. Breathtaking canyon cutting through Ronda.

name: Plaza de Toros de Ronda
description: Wonderful piece of architecture where you get to see behind the scenes. One of Spain's oldest and most prestigious bullrings with museum. Real Maestranza de Caballería manages this historic legacy.
address: Calle Virgen de la Paz, 15, 29400 Ronda, Spain

name: Historic Center Of Ronda
description: Old town is very beautiful with lots to see. Old houses on steep streets, historic buildings, charming atmosphere. Well worth wander across bridge to old city.

name: Baños Arabes
description: Most complete Arab Baths in Spain. Bit of hike to baths and seemingly bigger hike back in heat of day. Well-preserved 13th-century hammam with excellent historical information.
address: Calle Molino de Alarcón, s/n, 29400 Ronda, Spain
opening_hours: Mon-Fri 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Sat-Sun 10:00 AM - 3:00 PM

name: Alameda del Tajo
description: Pretty small, well-maintained park with nice little route to Balcón del Coño offering stunning views. Beautiful gardens overlooking countryside below. Spectacular valley views.
address: Paseo Blas Infante, s/n, 29400 Ronda, Spain

name: Palacio de Mondragón
description: Historic palace worth more time than quick visit. See house, gardens, and spectacular views. Municipal museum with archaeological collections and beautiful Mudéjar patios.
address: Plaza de Mondragón, s/n, 29400 Ronda, Spain
opening_hours: Mon-Fri 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Sat-Sun 10:00 AM - 3:00 PM

name: Iglesia de Santa Maria la Mayor
description: Church worth visit, especially walking to top for lovely views of town and countryside. Make sure to go to roof level. Built on site of main mosque with mix of architectural styles.
address: Plaza Duquesa de Parcent, s/n, 29400 Ronda, Spain

name: Puente Viejo (Old Bridge)
description: Puente Nuevo gets much attention deservedly, but if you seek out old bridge you can have great views. 17th-century bridge offering different perspective of gorge.

name: Casa Museo Don Bosco
description: From garden there is cliff edge lookout point offering one of best views of gorge and bridge. Museum with eclectic collections and spectacular terrace views.

name: Roman Bridge (Puente Romano)
description: Scenic bridge well worth stop and very good photo opportunity, especially on down-river side. Ancient Roman bridge rebuilt in medieval period.

name: Casa del Rey Moro
description: Historic house with beautiful gardens and famous water mine. 365 steps descend into gorge through secret passage carved into rock. Stunning terraced gardens designed by Forestier.
address: Cuesta de Santo Domingo, 9, 29400 Ronda, Spain

name: Mirador del Puente Nuevo
description: Great hike offering spectacular views of Puente Nuevo from below. Best viewpoint for photographing the bridge spanning the dramatic gorge.
address: Camino de los Molinos, 29400 Ronda, Spain

name: Museo Lara Ronda
description: Large eclectic collection: cameras, jewels, typewriters, electrical goods. Basement features witchcraft and Holy Inquisition items. Personal collection built over years.

name: Iglesia de Nuestra Senora de la Merced
description: Commanding entrance of Church of Our Lady of the Merced and Convent of Descalced Carmelites. Baroque church with impressive facade and religious art.
address: Plaza de la Merced, s/n, 29400 Ronda, Spain

name: Ciudad Romana de Acinipo
description: Roman ruins including Roman amphitheatre. Ruins from earlier cultures as well. You may be one of few people there. Ancient city ruins 20km from Ronda.

name: Paseo de Blas Infante
description: If you don't like heights, don't look down. Beautiful place, spectacular landscape, perfect for chill out and golden sunset. Clifftop walkway with vertiginous views.
address: Paseo de Blas Infante, 29400 Ronda, Spain

name: Plaza del Socorro
description: Really nice square in Ronda. Nice church plus restaurants and bars in area. Also flowers and occasional statue. Fountain at center.

name: Puerta de Almocabar
description: Word 'Almocábar' derives from Arabic 'Al Maqabir', meaning 'cemetery', as gate led to ancient burial grounds. 13th-century Moorish gateway with horseshoe arch.

name: Plaza Duquesa de Parcent
description: Lot of history in this beautiful and inspiring plaza. Main square in old town surrounded by historic buildings including Santa María church and town hall.
address: Plaza Duquesa de Parcent, 29400 Ronda, Spain

description: There are still several restaurants and shops on the Balcon but our experience this time was nothing special. It is a...

name: Church of El Salvador
description: This wonderful and historic building is right in the centre of town and is a focal point for any walk around the centre.

name: Punta Lara
description: We visited punta Lara in May the weather was great, hot and sunny, punta Lara had just won prettiest village award...

name: Monumento A Chanquete
description: This statue is tucked away beneath the Balcon de Europa and so not all the visitors to the town will see it. There is a...

name: Fuente de Europa
description: Interestingly one of the blocks has the inscription "ENGLAND" instead of the perhaps expected UK - not sure if that's...

name: Fuente del Esparto
description: The first 5km is a bit of a trek through the national park, a gentle uphill walk but after the recreation ground it...

name: Centro Cultural Villa de Nerja
description: In the last two weeks we saw an Argentina Tango show, Norwegian Trad Jazz band, and a Queen Tribute band, all shows...
