description: The San Joaquin Sugar Factory - Historic Sites

name: Ermita de Nuestra Señora de las Angustias
description: Ermita de Nuestra Señora de las Angustias - Churches & Cathedrals

name: Nerja Anglican Church
description: Nerja Anglican Church - Churches & Cathedrals

name: Estatua De Don Quijote
description: Estatua De Don Quijote - Monuments & Statues

name: Fuente Cantarero
description: Fuente Cantarero - Fountains

name: Conjunto Monumental de La Alcazaba
description: Impressive Moorish fortress complex overlooking the city. One of the largest alcazabas built by the Moors, featuring beautiful gardens, towers, and panoramic views of Almería. Free admission makes it even better to visit early in the morning to avoid the heat.

name: Paseo de Almeria
description: The main pedestrian boulevard and shopping street of Almería. Perfect place for shopping and breathing the Andalusian atmosphere with beautiful historic buildings, cafes, and shops lining the tree-shaded promenade.

name: Playa de los Genoveses
description: Most beautiful beach in Cabo de Gata Natural Park. Wide, pristine sandy beach with crystal-clear waters, backed by dunes and minimal development. Popular but never overcrowded, perfect for swimming and relaxing in natural surroundings.

name: Faro Cabo de Gata
description: Historic lighthouse at the southernmost point of Cabo de Gata with spectacular coastal views. While the lighthouse itself is not accessible, the dramatic rocky coastline and sweeping ocean vistas make it worth the visit. Long, clean beach nearby.

name: Playa Isleta del Moro
description: Charming beach in a traditional fishing village with colorful boats. Small, protected cove with calm waters perfect for swimming and snorkeling. Nearby attractions include lighthouse, Playa de Mónsul, and excellent local seafood restaurants.

name: Playa Las Salinas
description: Miles and miles of clear sand with very few people on this fantastic beach. Remote location means bring your own food and water, but you'll be rewarded with a pristine, uncrowded beach experience. Part of the Las Salinas natural area.

name: Cala Raja
description: Secluded cove beach in Cabo de Gata Natural Park surrounded by nature and wildlife. Small, peaceful beach with clear waters, ideal for those seeking tranquility away from crowds.

name: Fabriquilla Beach
description: More secluded beach on the road towards the lighthouse. Water activities available from the beach including kayaking and snorkeling. Nice and quiet with good facilities.

name: Playa San Miguel
description: Beach with traditional fishing boats creating an idyllic scene. Plenty of parking space nearby and authentic fishing village atmosphere. Great for photography with the colorful boats on the beach.

name: Playa del Corralete
description: Hidden gem beach with excellent ratings. Small, pristine beach in Cabo de Gata with clear waters and natural beauty. Less known than other beaches, offering a more private experience.

name: Playa Los Barquicos
description: Small, quiet beach in Cabo de Gata Natural Park. Minimal facilities but beautiful natural setting with clear waters.

name: Escuela de Arte de Almeria
description: Historic art school building with beautiful architecture. The entrance includes an audio guide. Not very big but features a nice and spacious patio worth visiting.

name: Antigua Estacion de Ferrocarril
description: Historic old railway station building showcasing Almería's industrial heritage. Beautiful 19th-century architecture worth seeing even if not traveling by train.

name: The Statue of John Lennon
description: Tribute statue to John Lennon. Not well signposted so can be difficult to find, but worth seeking out for Beatles fans. A unique monument in Almería's urban landscape.

name: Monastery of the Virgin Del Saliente
description: Historic monastery in a scenic location. Wheelchair friendly with flat terrain. Features a restaurant and hotel. Beautiful religious site with cultural significance.

name: Mirador Balcon del Almanzora
description: Scenic viewpoint overlooking the Almanzora valley. Offers panoramic views of the surrounding countryside.

name: Alcázar de Jerez de la Frontera
description: Well-preserved Moorish fortress and palace complex. Originally built in the 11th century, it features beautiful gardens, a mosque converted to chapel, and Arab baths. Excellent value at only €5 entrance fee. The complex showcases the evolution of Islamic and Christian architecture over centuries.

name: Catedral de Jerez de la Frontera
description: Beautiful cathedral with great architectural features combining Gothic and Baroque styles. Very calm and welcoming atmosphere. Built on the site of the former main mosque, it features impressive artwork and religious treasures. Well worth a visit for its historical and artistic significance.

name: Feria del Caballo
description: Famous annual horse fair held in May, one of Andalusia's most important festivals. Features elaborate casetas (tents), flamenco dancing, traditional dress, horse parades, and exhibitions. Regular folks have an absolute blast dancing in the streets. Visitors can experience authentic Andalusian culture and the region's deep connection with horses and sherry.

name: Palacio del Virrey Laserna
description: Magnificent 18th-century aristocratic palace still owned by the same family. Excellent guided tours in English that explain the history of the family and unique objects in the palace. Features stunning architecture, period furnishings, and provides insight into the lifestyle of Jerez's sherry aristocracy.

name: Iglesia de San Miguel
description: One of Jerez's most important churches, featuring spectacular Gothic and Baroque architecture. Often visited with a combined ticket that includes the cathedral and audio guide. Notable for its ornate altarpiece and beautiful interior decorations. Representative of the city's rich religious heritage.

name: Camara Oscura Alcazar Jerez de la Frontera
description: Camera obscura experience located in the Alcázar tower. For just €2 supplement to the Alcázar entrance fee, you get guided access to this fascinating optical device that projects live panoramic views of the city. The tower offers spectacular 360-degree views of Jerez from the top.

name: Cartuja de Jerez
description: Beautiful 15th-century Carthusian monastery with stunning architecture. Features a small museum and shop. The areas open to the public are restricted but the Gothic and Baroque elements are spectacular. Peaceful cloisters and chapels showcase fine religious art and sculptural details.

name: Rancho Cortesano - Museo de la Miel
description: Unique honey museum and working farm offering interactive experiences with beekeeping. Visitors can learn about honey production, taste different varieties, and enjoy demonstrations. Great for families and those interested in traditional agriculture. The passionate staff provide excellent explanations about bees and honey.

name: Convento de Santo Domingo
description: Historic Dominican convent with beautiful cloisters pleasant to walk around. The stonework is particularly impressive. Worth visiting to admire the medieval architecture and peaceful atmosphere. Often hosts cultural events and exhibitions.

name: Como bailan los caballos andaluces
description: Andalusian horse dancing show showcasing the beauty and training of these magnificent horses. Book in advance to ensure you don't miss this attraction. You can wander through the gardens and visit the stables. A must-see for horse enthusiasts visiting Jerez.

name: Jerez De La Frontera Railway Station
description: Clean, well-maintained historic railway station with helpful English-speaking staff. Beautiful architecture and convenient location near the town center. Features nice facilities including clean toilets and waiting areas. Good example of early 20th-century Spanish railway architecture.

name: Iglesia de San Mateo
description: Beautiful elongated church located in San Dionisio square. Features Gothic and Mudéjar architectural elements. Known for its impressive interior and historical significance in Jerez's religious landscape.

name: Church of San Dionisio
description: Historic church in the center of Jerez with Mudéjar architecture. One of the oldest churches in the city, dating back to the 13th century. Features a distinctive bell tower and beautiful interior decorations.

name: Palacio Domecq
description: Historic palace belonging to the famous Domecq sherry family. Beautiful 18th-century architecture representative of Jerez's sherry aristocracy. Note: Opening hours can be irregular, check before visiting. When open, offers insight into the lifestyle of sherry barons.

name: Alcazaba de Antequera
description: Medieval Moorish fortress perched on a hill overlooking the city. Worth the walk up the hill to see this Alcazaba with interesting towers and panoramic views of the city below. The fortress features well-preserved defensive walls and provides insight into the Moorish period of Andalusian history.

name: Dolmen de Menga
description: One of the largest and most impressive dolmens in Europe, dating from 3750-3650 BCE. Part of the UNESCO World Heritage Dolmens of Antequera site. The structure features massive stone slabs weighing up to 180 tons. Well preserved and excellently presented with good parking and visitor facilities. A fascinating glimpse into prehistoric engineering.

name: Dolmenes de Antequera
description: UNESCO World Heritage site comprising three megalithic monuments: Menga, Viera, and El Romeral dolmens. Easy and pleasant walk from the bus station and center of Antequera. These Neolithic structures showcase remarkable prehistoric engineering and astronomical alignment. The site provides comprehensive interpretation and is well-maintained.

name: Colegiata de Santa Maria la Mayor
description: Renaissance collegiate church with stunning architecture. Recommended viewing of the church roof from the Alcazaba for a spectacular perspective. The inside features unusual architectural elements worth careful examination. One of the most important Renaissance buildings in Andalusia, showcasing impressive stonework and artistic details.

name: Dolmen del Romeral
description: The third dolmen in the UNESCO World Heritage complex, featuring a distinctive domed chamber. Dating from around 1800 BCE, it represents a later architectural style with corbelled vaulting. Well worth the visit to complete the three-dolmen experience. The structure showcases advanced prehistoric building techniques.

name: Arco de Los Gigantes
description: Impressive 16th-century triumphal arch with stunning views all around and fascinating history. Built to commemorate Charles I's visit, it incorporates Roman inscriptions and sculptures. The arch serves as a gateway to the historic center. Definitely go in and pay for a guided tour to learn about the area's rich history.

name: El Carmen Church
description: Amazingly beautiful church inside with spectacular Mudéjar wooden ceiling. Really recommendable and a must if you visit the old city of Antequera. The baroque altarpiece and artistic details make this one of the most impressive churches in the city. Features stunning interior decorations and religious art.

name: Fuente de Piedra
description: Natural lagoon and nature reserve, home to one of Europe's largest flamingo colonies. Just a short drive from Antequera, very close to the A92. The lagoon (Laguna de Fuente de Piedra) offers excellent birdwatching opportunities, especially during breeding season. Beautiful natural setting with visitor center and observation points.

name: Iglesia de San Sebastian
description: The most ornate of all 28 churches in Antequera. Features elaborate Baroque decorations and an impressive bell tower that dominates the city skyline. The interior showcases exceptional religious art and gilded altarpieces. A fine example of Andalusian Baroque architecture.

name: Convento de Belen
description: Beautiful convent in the heart of Antequera, well worth a visit. Features lovely architecture and peaceful cloisters. Note: some visitors mention preference for traditional candles over plastic ones. The convent maintains its authentic character and provides a quiet retreat from the bustling town center.

name: Dolmen de Viera
description: One of the three UNESCO dolmens, featuring a long corridor leading to a burial chamber. Well preserved and well presented with excellent visitor facilities. The dolmen dates from around 3510 BCE and showcases sophisticated megalithic construction. Good parking and well-routed paths make it easy to visit.

name: Iglesia de San Juan de Dios
description: Exceptional value at only one Euro per person for entry. Absolutely incredible on the inside with stunning baroque decorations. The church features impressive frescoes, gilded altarpieces, and religious artwork. One of Antequera's hidden gems with a beautifully preserved interior.

name: Mirador de Antequera
description: Viewpoint offering panoramic views of Antequera and surrounding countryside. Note: you need a car park ticket to access the deck area (swipe barcode on gate to unlock). Great photo opportunities of the town, La Peña de los Enamorados, and El Torcal in the distance.

name: Iglesia de Nuestra Señora de los Remedios
description: In many opinions, the most beautiful of Antequera's churches. Almost every surface is covered with intricate decorations including stunning frescoes, baroque altarpieces, and gilded details. The convent church showcases exceptional craftsmanship and religious art. A masterpiece of Andalusian baroque architecture.

name: Town Hall
description: Beautiful historic building with enthusiastic and friendly staff. The town hall occasionally hosts cultural events and fairs. Features traditional Andalusian architecture and serves as a central landmark in the historic center. The building and square create a pleasant atmosphere for visitors.

name: Albayzín
description: Historic Moorish quarter with narrow lanes, whitewashed houses, and viewpoints of the Alhambra.

name: Generalife
description: Summer palace and terraced gardens of the Nasrid rulers above the Alhambra.

name: Mirador de San Nicolás
description: Famous viewpoint with postcard views of the Alhambra and Sierra Nevada, especially at sunset.

name: Balcón de Europa
description: Large balcony viewpoint on cliff offering magnificent panoramic views of the Mediterranean Sea and beaches. One of the most popular spots in Nerja surrounded by beautiful cliffs, unlike the rest of Costa del Sol.

name: La Giralda
description: Iconic bell tower and former minaret of Seville Cathedral, with a ramped climb and excellent views.
address: Avenida de la Constitución, s/n, 41004 Sevilla

name: Plaza de España
description: Iconic semicircular plaza with tiled alcoves representing Spanish provinces and a central canal.
address: Av. de Isabel la Católica, 41004 Sevilla

name: Alhambra de Granada
description: Stunning Moorish palace and fortress complex showcasing Islamic architecture at its finest. The Nasrid Palaces feature intricate stucco work, the Generalife gardens offer peaceful courtyards, and the Alcazaba fortress provides panoramic city views.
opening_hours: Early morning or late afternoon to avoid crowds and heat

name: Albaicín Neighborhood
description: UNESCO World Heritage medieval Moorish quarter with narrow cobblestone streets, white-washed houses, and stunning viewpoints. The neighborhood retains its Islamic urban layout and offers authentic Granada charm.
opening_hours: Late afternoon for sunset views from miradores

name: Monastery of La Cartuja
description: Spectacular Carthusian monastery showcasing the height of Spanish Baroque art. The sacristy is considered one of the finest examples of baroque architecture in Spain, with extraordinary marble work and paintings.

name: Fundación Rodríguez-Acosta
description: Hidden gem art museum in a stunning early 20th-century carmen with terraced gardens. Houses the collection of Granada painter José María Rodríguez-Acosta, combining artwork with architectural beauty.

name: Bañuelo (Arab Baths)
description: Best-preserved Moorish baths in Spain, dating from the 11th century. Located in the Albaicín, these atmospheric baths show the sophisticated hydraulic engineering of Al-Andalus.

name: Palacio de Dar al-Horra
description: 15th-century Nasrid palace in the Albaicín, once home to the mother of Boabdil, the last Moorish king of Granada. Features beautiful original decorations and offers insight into noble Islamic domestic architecture.

name: Hospital Real
description: Magnificent Renaissance building commissioned by the Catholic Monarchs, now part of the University of Granada. Features beautiful courtyards and often hosts cultural exhibitions.

name: Huerta de San Vicente
description: Summer home of poet Federico García Lorca, now a museum dedicated to his life and work. Set in a peaceful garden, the house preserves the poet's personal belongings and writing spaces.

name: Casa del Chapiz
description: Pair of 16th-century Moorish houses in the Albaicín, now home to the School of Arabic Studies. Beautiful example of mudéjar architecture with stunning gardens and valley views.

name: Cueva-Museo del Sacromonte
description: Cave museum in the historic gypsy quarter showing traditional cave dwelling life and flamenco culture. Demonstrates how families lived in the Sacromonte caves with period furnishings and tools.

name: Iglesia de Santa Catalina
description: One of oldest churches in Seville, 14th-century church built on remains of former mosque. Beautiful mudéjar tower and baroque interior decorations.

name: Iglesia de San Isidoro
description: Interesting church with altar covered with pink cherubs as notable feature. Worth quick visit and prayer. Beautiful baroque decoration.

name: Iglesia de San Bernardo
description: Situated in Nervión district, church has fantastic interior flooded by natural light. Beautiful baroque architecture and impressive altarpiece.

name: Jardines de las Delicias
description: Lovely quiet garden area with number of sculptures, water features, and nicely landscaped areas. Worth a peaceful visit along riverside.

name: Generalife
description: Beautiful Moorish summer palace and gardens with stunning courtyards, fountains, and landscaping. Part of the Alhambra complex with spectacular views and peaceful walking paths.
address: Calle Real de la Alhambra, s/n, 18009 Granada, Spain

name: Mirador de San Nicolás
description: Famous viewpoint offering the most iconic panoramic views of the Alhambra against the Sierra Nevada mountains, especially stunning at sunset.
address: Plaza de San Nicolás, Albaicín, 18010 Granada, Spain

name: Patio de los Leones
description: Iconic courtyard in the Nasrid Palaces featuring 124 marble columns and the famous fountain with 12 lion sculptures. Masterpiece of Islamic architecture.
address: Within Nasrid Palaces, Alhambra, Granada, Spain

name: Museum of Alhambra
description: Museum showcasing Hispano-Muslim art and artifacts from the Alhambra, including ceramics, woodwork, and architectural fragments from the Nasrid period.
address: Palacio de Carlos V, Calle Real de la Alhambra, s/n, 18009 Granada, Spain
opening_hours: Wed-Sat 8:30 AM - 8:00 PM, Sun-Tue 8:30 AM - 2:30 PM

name: Fundación Rodríguez-Acosta
description: Art foundation featuring beautiful gardens, archaeological museum, and art collections in a stunning early 20th-century carmen with excellent Alhambra views.
address: Callejón Niños del Rollo, 8, 18009 Granada, Spain

name: Palacio de Dar al-Horra
description: 15th-century Nasrid palace that was home to the mother of the last Moorish king Boabdil, featuring authentic Moorish architecture and peaceful gardens.
address: Callejón de las Monjas, s/n, 18010 Granada, Spain

name: Hospital Real
description: Early 16th-century royal hospital building with impressive Renaissance architecture, now part of the University of Granada. Built to treat those wounded in the War of Granada.
address: Calle Ancha de Capuchinos, 4, 18071 Granada, Spain

name: Puerta del Vino
description: Historic Nasrid gateway within the Alhambra grounds, famously depicted in Claude Debussy's piano composition. Features beautiful Islamic architectural details.

name: Mirador de la Abadía del Sacromonte
description: Stunning viewpoint near the Sacromonte Abbey offering panoramic sunset views of Granada, the Alhambra, and surrounding valleys.
address: Near Abadía del Sacromonte, Granada, Spain

name: Monumento a Federico García Lorca
description: Monument statue honoring Granada's most famous poet Federico García Lorca, depicting him holding his 'Romancero Gitano' poetry collection.
address: Plaza de la Romanilla, Granada, Spain

name: Casa del Chapiz
description: Moorish house with pleasant gardens, now housing the School of Arabic Studies. Nice gardens but less impressive than the Alhambra.

name: Patio de los Leones
description: Court of Lions courtyard in the Nasrid Palaces, featuring over 100 slender columns surrounding the courtyard and 12 lion sculptures supporting the fountain.
address: Within Nasrid Palaces, Alhambra, Granada, Spain

name: Alhambra Monument Statue
description: Commemorative statue near the Alhambra. Private tour guide Juan Cobo Civantos highly recommended for Alhambra tours.

name: Bañuelo (Arab Baths)
description: 11th-century Arab baths, one of the best-preserved medieval bathhouses in Spain. Features horseshoe arches, star-shaped skylights, and original hot, warm, and cold rooms.

name: Palacio Del Marques De La Motilla
description: Historic palace museum with impressive architecture. Small but beautiful specialty museum in restored aristocratic residence.

name: Museo de Malaga
description: Very compact museum with small archaeological collection on ground floor and art galleries above. Well-presented with limited but informative text.
address: Plaza de la Aduana, s/n, 29015 Málaga, Spain
entrance_fee: Free for EU citizens, €1.50 for non-EU
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 9:00 AM - 9:00 PM, Sun 9:00 AM - 3:00 PM

name: Parque de Malaga
description: Beautiful urban park with tropical plants, fountains, and shaded walkways. Perfect for relaxing strolls between city sights along the waterfront.
address: Paseo del Parque, s/n, 29016 Málaga, Spain

name: Plaza de toros de La Malagueta
description: Historic 19th-century bullring near La Malagueta beach. Neo-Mudéjar architecture, guided tours available showing bullfighting history and traditions.

name: Museo de las Cortes de Cadiz
description: Museum featuring large wall painting showing 1812 Constitution ceremony. Limited information about constitution but interesting historical perspective.
opening_hours: Tue-Fri 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Sat-Sun 9:00 AM - 2:00 PM

description: Entertainment in Marbella. TripAdvisor rating: 4.0/5 from 180 reviews.

name: Muelle del Tinto
description: Impressive historic pier structure on the Tinto River, beautiful whether illuminated in daylight or by LEDs at night. The Paseo along the pier offers stunning views and is a focal point for visitors. Built in the early 20th century to export minerals, now a major landmark and symbol of Huelva's industrial heritage.

name: Plaza De Las Monjas
description: Central plaza in Huelva with interesting surrounding streets. The square serves as a hub for the city with many cafes and shops. Good place to experience local life and start exploring the historic center.

name: Playa de Cuesta Maneli
description: Beautiful natural beach in Doñana Natural Park area. It suffered a forest fire 2 years ago and is slowly recovering, but remains a stunning location. Paradise beach with wild, unspoiled character and connection to nature. Requires some walking to reach but worth the effort.

name: Barrio Obrero Reina Victoria
description: Historic working-class neighborhood with unique architecture built by British mining company in early 1900s. Garden city design with distinctive English-style housing. A visit to history that offers fascinating insight into Huelva's mining past and British influence. Charming streets and well-preserved buildings.

name: Monumento a Colón
description: Impressive monument to Christopher Columbus at Punta del Sebo where the Tinto and Odiel rivers meet before reaching the sea. Designed by New York sculptress Gertrude Vanderbilt Whitney in cubist style since 1929. Symbolizes Huelva's crucial role in Columbus's 1492 voyage to the Americas.

name: Catedral de Huelva
description: Santa Iglesia Catedral de la Merced, located at Plaza de la Merced in the city center. The cathedral combines baroque and neoclassical elements. While not the most ornate cathedral in Andalusia, it holds religious and historical significance for Huelva.

name: Santuario de Nuestra Señora de La Cinta
description: Beautiful sanctuary on a hill overlooking the city. Walking from the city through Parque Moret is a nice stroll and the gardens are a good place to rest. The sanctuary has special significance for Huelva residents and offers panoramic views of the city and port.

name: Casa Colón
description: Historic building with beautiful central courtyard providing a cool and restful place to stop. Connected to Columbus's voyage history. The architecture reflects Huelva's connection to the Discovery of the Americas. Often hosts cultural exhibitions and events.

name: Monumento a la Virgen del Rocío
description: Brilliant monument commemorating a significant event in El Rocío pilgrimage. The sculpture shows impressive movement and artistic quality. Represents the deep religious devotion associated with the Virgin of El Rocío, one of Andalusia's most important religious celebrations.

name: Playa de El Portil
description: Popular beach near Huelva with good facilities and services. More developed than wild beaches, suitable for families. Long sandy beach with restaurants and beach bars nearby.

name: Iglesia de San Pedro
description: Charming church situated in a lovely little square with very attractive façade. A peaceful square in front of the church makes it a pleasant place to visit. Features traditional Andalusian religious architecture.

name: Ayuntamiento de Huelva
description: City Hall of Huelva, an important civic building in the city center. Notable architecture representing municipal government. Landmark building that anchors the historic center.

name: Parroquia Purísima Concepción
description: Parish church of the Immaculate Conception with notable religious architecture. Important church for the local community with beautiful interior decorations.

name: Plaza de Toros
description: Historic bullring of Huelva, representing traditional Andalusian culture. Architecture typical of Spanish bullrings with circular design.

name: Playa de los Enebrales
description: Natural beach along the Huelva coast with characteristic vegetation. Less crowded than main resort beaches, offers a more natural beach experience.

name: Palacio de Mora Claros
description: Historic palace in Huelva city center showcasing aristocratic architecture. Beautiful building that represents Huelva's historic noble families and their influence on the city.

name: Collegiate Church of Our Lady of the Assumption
description: Stunning Renaissance collegiate church in Osuna, one of Andalusia's finest examples of 16th-century religious architecture. Features impressive baroque chapels, valuable artwork, and the Pantheon of the Dukes. Famous as a Game of Thrones filming location (Season 5 - Fighting Pits of Meereen). The church and its museum house important religious art collections.

name: El Coto Las Canteras
description: Ancient Roman quarry and necropolis carved into rock, used as Game of Thrones filming location (Fighting Pits scenes). Fascinating archaeological site showing ancient stone extraction methods. The carved chambers and passages create an atmospheric underground complex. Part of Osuna's ducal heritage with impressive stone structures.

name: Escuela Universitaria de Osuna
description: Historic 16th-century university building, one of the earliest universities in Andalusia founded in 1548. Beautiful Renaissance architecture with impressive courtyard and façade. Now serves as cultural center and can be visited. Important example of Spanish academic architecture from the Golden Age.

name: Museo de Osuna
description: Archaeological and fine arts museum showcasing Osuna's rich history from Iberian and Roman periods through to modern times. Houses important bronze sculptures and archaeological finds. Located in a beautiful historic building. Good introduction to the town's 3000-year history.

name: Palace of the Marques de la Gomera
description: Impressive 18th-century baroque palace belonging to one of Osuna's noble families. Beautiful façade and interior courtyards showcasing aristocratic architecture. Now used for cultural events. Represents the wealth and power of Osuna's ducal families. Notable baroque towers visible from throughout the town.

name: Calle Sevilla
description: Main historic street of Osuna lined with noble palaces, mansions, and important buildings. Perfect for strolling and experiencing the town's aristocratic heritage. Many buildings feature beautiful baroque and Renaissance façades. Good restaurants and shops. Connects main monuments.

name: Palace of Benameji
description: Magnificent 18th-century baroque palace, now housing the Historical Museum of Écija. Beautiful painted ceilings, frescoes, and interior courtyards showcase the wealth of Écija's noble families. The museum displays archaeological finds including Roman mosaics and artifacts. Stunning example of Andalusian baroque architecture with its distinctive pink façade.

name: Palacio de Peñaflor
description: Stunning baroque palace with one of the most impressive painted façades in Andalusia. The curved balcony and elaborate frescoes make it a masterpiece of 18th-century civil architecture. Beautiful interior courtyards with marble columns. Famous for its sinuous 'snake' balcony that runs the length of the building. Icon of Écija's architectural heritage.

name: Iglesia de los Descalzos
description: Beautiful baroque church with stunning interior decorations and altarpieces. Known for its elaborate religious art and gilded baroque altars. Part of Écija's collection of impressive religious buildings. Peaceful atmosphere and fine example of Andalusian baroque religious architecture. Notable tower visible from distance.

name: Terra Oleum Museo Activo Del Aceite De Oliva
description: Active olive oil museum with guided tours of production process, tasting sessions, and shop. One of the best olive oil experiences in Jaén province.

name: Oleoturismo en Jaén con Picualia
description: Premium olive oil mill tour with tastings of award-winning oils. Learn from harvest to bottling.

name: Oleoturismo Viaje al Mundo del Aceite
description: Family-run mill near UNESCO cities. Daily tours showing traditional and modern production. Free tasting of Extra Virgin oils.

name: Centro de Interpretación Olivar y Aceite
description: Interactive museum about olive culture in UNESCO city of Úbeda. Explains cultivation, production, and cultural importance.

name: Museo de la Cultura del Olivo
description: Comprehensive museum in historic Baeza about olive oil history, production, and tasting techniques.

name: Jaen Cathedral
description: Magnificent Renaissance cathedral, one of Andalusia's architectural masterpieces. Designed by Andrés de Vandelvira with impressive façade and interior.

name: Centro Cultural Banos Arabes
description: Largest and best-preserved Arab baths in Spain. 11th-century hammam with beautiful horseshoe arches beneath Palacio Villardompardo.

name: Claritas Turismo
description: Highly-rated tour company for Jaén city and province. Walking tours, olive oil experiences, and nature excursions.

name: La Cruz
description: Spectacular viewpoint overlooking Jaén city and olive groves. Large cross monument, popular sunset spot.

name: Museo de Jaén
description: Provincial museum with important Iberian sculptures and archaeological collections. Roman and medieval artifacts.

name: Baeza Old Town
description: UNESCO World Heritage Renaissance town. Stunning palaces, churches, and plazas from Spain's Golden Age. Perfect preserved historic center.

name: Natural Park Sierras de Cazorla
description: Spain's largest protected area. Mountains, rivers, waterfalls, and wildlife including ibex. Hiking, rafting, and nature tourism.

name: Cathedral de Baeza
description: Renaissance cathedral in UNESCO town. Beautiful interior and cloisters, part of Baeza's monumental ensemble.

name: Castillo de Sabiote
description: Well-preserved Renaissance castle with guided tours. Impressive fortifications and views over olive groves.

name: Plaza del Populo
description: Beautiful Renaissance plaza in Baeza. Lion fountain, historic buildings, heart of UNESCO old town.

name: Castillo de Alcaudete
description: Medieval fortress with museum. Panoramic views over olive country. Interactive exhibits on border castle history.

name: Iberian Lynx Land
description: Wildlife watching tours for endangered Iberian lynx. Also see deer, eagles, vultures in Sierra de Andújar Natural Park.

name: Alvear
description: Historic winery founded 1729, producing world-famous Pedro Ximénez sweet wines. Guided tours through ancient cellars and solera system. Tasting of Oloroso and Amontillado wines. One of Spain's oldest wineries.

name: Bodegas Lagar Blanco
description: Family winery offering absorbing tours of traditional wine production in Montilla-Moriles DO. Beautiful bodega with excellent tastings. Authentic experience in wine region near Córdoba.

name: Perez Barquero
description: Massive wine production hidden behind white walls in Montilla. Traditional bodega producing Pedro Ximénez and fino wines. Tours of impressive cellars and aging rooms.

name: Bioparc Fuengirola
description: Excellent habitat immersion zoo featuring Madagascar, Equatorial Africa, and Southeast Asia. Natural enclosures where animals roam freely. Gorillas, elephants, tigers, lemurs. Educational and conservation-focused. Family-friendly, allow 3-4 hours.

name: Los Boliches
description: Typically Spanish neighborhood area of Fuengirola with authentic character. Traditional tapas bars, local restaurants, and family-run shops. Less touristy than central Fuengirola. Great for experiencing local life on Costa del Sol.

name: Castle of Sohail
description: 10th-century Moorish castle overlooking Mediterranean and town. Recently restored with exhibition spaces. Hosts summer concerts and festivals. Walk up from beach promenade. Free entry with nice views. Small museum inside.

name: Fuengirola Street Market
description: Large Tuesday street market with hundreds of stalls. Clothes, accessories, local products, and souvenirs. Much more authentic than beach tourist shops. Popular with locals and visitors. Arrive morning for best selection.

name: Plaza Constitucion
description: Central plaza in Fuengirola with cafes and restaurants. Hub of town life with regular events and markets. Surrounded by shops and tapas bars. Good starting point for exploring old town.

name: La Plaza de los Chinorros
description: Charming small plaza in old town with traditional Andalusian character. Tapas bars and cafes with outdoor seating. Popular with locals. Part of historic Fuengirola walking routes.

name: Paseo Maritimo Rey De España
description: Excellent beachfront promenade connecting Fuengirola to Benalmádena (7km). Palm-lined walkway with beach access, chiringuitos, and sea views. Popular for walking, running, cycling. Connects to other coastal towns.

name: Rio Fuengirola Pedestrian Bridge
description: Modern cable-stayed pedestrian bridge over Rio de Fuengirola. Striking contemporary design connecting beach to town center. Illuminated at night. Popular photo spot and town landmark.

name: Playa de Fuengirola
description: Beautiful golden sand beach stretching 8km along coast. Blue Flag status, clean and well-maintained. Beach bars, sunbed rentals, watersports. Family-friendly with calm waters and lifeguards. Easy access from town.

name: Fuengirola Adventure Golf
description: Fun mini golf course with themed holes. Good for families and groups. Two 18-hole courses. Open late evenings. Bar on site.

name: The Salon Varietes Theatre
description: Long-established English-language theatre in Fuengirola. Productions, comedy shows, and musicals. Popular with expat community. Professional performances in intimate venue.

name: Mezquita de Fuengirola
description: Suhail Islamic Cultural Centre, one of few mosques on Costa del Sol. Moorish architecture in modern building. Visitors welcome outside prayer times. Cultural center with library and exhibitions.

name: Santuario de Nuestra Senora de Araceli
description: Hilltop sanctuary with panoramic views over olive groves. Important pilgrimage site. Beautiful baroque interior. Popular viewpoint and walking destination.

name: Castillo del Moral
description: Medieval castle where last Moorish king Boabdil was imprisoned. Archaeological museum inside. Well-preserved fortress in Lucena town center.

name: Your Andalucia
description: Highly-rated tour company specializing in authentic Andalusian experiences. Cultural tours, food experiences, and custom itineraries.

name: Centro Cicloturista Subbetica
description: Cycling tourism center in Subbetica Natural Park. Bike rentals, guided routes, and cycling tours through olive groves and white villages.

name: Villa Romana de Fuente Alamo
description: Roman villa ruins with well-preserved mosaics. Archaeological site with informative displays. Insight into Roman life in Andalusia.

name: Centro de Artes Mijas
description: Contemporary art center in charming white village of Mijas. Rotating exhibitions of Spanish and international artists. Beautiful building with views. Small but excellent collection showcasing modern art in traditional Andalusian setting.

name: Toma & Coe
description: Premium personalized tour company - Traditional Original Magnificent Andalucia. Custom private tours throughout region including Ronda, white villages, wineries, and cultural experiences. Highly-rated for authentic local experiences.

name: Ardales National Park
description: Natural park surrounding El Caminito del Rey. Lakes, gorges, and rugged mountain scenery. Excellent hiking, rock climbing, and nature activities. Home to Caminito del Rey cliffside walkway. Multiple trails and viewpoints.

name: Parque Natural Punta Entinas
description: Coastal natural park near Almería with dunes, salt flats, and wetlands. Important bird sanctuary with flamingos. Quiet beaches and walking trails. Less crowded alternative to tourist beaches.

name: Parque Nacional Sierra De Las Nieves
description: Newly designated national park near Ronda. Ancient pinsapo pine forests, dramatic limestone peaks, and deep gorges. Excellent hiking including La Torrecilla peak (1919m). UNESCO Biosphere Reserve.

name: Punta de La Mona Lighthouse
description: Picturesque lighthouse on rocky headland with Mediterranean views. Popular walking destination from Almuñécar. Scenic coastal path. Good sunset spot.

name: Catedral de Almeria
description: Magnificent Renaissance fortress-cathedral built 1524-1562. Unique design combining cathedral and defensive fortress due to pirate threats. Pristine interior with impressive altarpieces. Gothic and Renaissance elements. €5 entry includes museum and rooftop access with city views.

name: Catedral de la Encarnacion
description: Also known as Almería Cathedral. Historic cathedral-fortress in city center. Beautiful architecture blending military and religious design. Entry fee includes guided tour.

name: Iglesia de la Virgen del Mar
description: Beautiful church with impressive golden altarpiece. Dedicated to patron saint of Almería. Well worth visiting for baroque interior decorations.

name: The Statue of John Lenon
description: Tribute statue to John Lennon in Almería. Not well signposted so ask locals for directions. Interesting Beatles connection in southern Spain.

name: Jardín Botánico La Almunya del Sur
description: Outdoor botanical museum dedicated to flora conservation and botanical education. Beautiful gardens showcasing Mediterranean and desert plants. Educational exhibits about regional biodiversity.

name: Clisol Turismo Agricola
description: Full inside tour of Almería's famous greenhouse farming - 'The European Vegetable Garden'. Discover cropping processes from seed to harvest. Unique agricultural tourism experience. See how Spain produces vegetables for all Europe.

name: Castillo de Guardias Viejas
description: Coastal fortress with wonderful views over town and sea. Remarkable battlements and well-preserved defensive structure. Historic watchtower protecting against pirate raids.

name: Puerto Almerimar
description: Modern marina with yachts and leisure facilities. Popular winter destination. Beach access, restaurants, and waterfront promenade. Good base for exploring Almería coast.

name: Memorial Rey Balduino / Villa Astrida
description: Historic villa and museum dedicated to Belgian King Baudouin who visited Motril. Beautiful gardens and exhibitions about the royal connection. Interesting local history museum.

name: Museo Preindustrial de la Cana de Azucar
description: Pre-industrial sugar cane museum. Excellent and informative exhibits about sugar cane history in Motril area. Working machinery demonstrations. Shows importance of tropical agriculture on Granada coast.

name: Finca Del Secretario
description: Free Roman archaeological site with interesting visitor information center. Clear and accessible route through ancient ruins. Well-preserved remains showing Roman villa life.

name: Parroquia de Nuestra Senora del Rosario
description: Church marking center of Fuengirola. Fascinating architecture and always something happening. Important landmark in town center.
